module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.AdvancedBackupSetting

-- | A list of backup options for each resource type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdvancedBackupSetting</a> smart constructor.
data AdvancedBackupSetting
AdvancedBackupSetting' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> AdvancedBackupSetting

-- | Specifies an object containing resource type and backup options. The
--   only supported resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see
--   the <a>sample CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS</a> in the
--   <i>Backup User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>EC2</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:AdvancedBackupSetting'] :: AdvancedBackupSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows VSS backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup.
--   The <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   If you specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
--   
--   For more information about Windows VSS backups, see <a>Creating a
--   VSS-Enabled Windows Backup</a>.
[$sel:backupOptions:AdvancedBackupSetting'] :: AdvancedBackupSetting -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>AdvancedBackupSetting</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   
--   Valid values: <tt>EC2</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:AdvancedBackupSetting'</a>,
--   <a>advancedBackupSetting_backupOptions</a> - Specifies the backup
--   option for a selected resource. This option is only available for
--   Windows VSS backup jobs.
--

--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultEvent.BackupVaultEvent


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupVaultListMember

-- | Contains metadata about a backup vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupVaultListMember</a> smart constructor.
data BackupVaultListMember
BackupVaultListMember' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> BackupVaultListMember

-- | The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration becomes
--   immutable, meaning it cannot be changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock
--   from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lockDate:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention
--   period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite
--   storage).
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the
--   maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than
--   that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy
--   job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a
--   different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to
--   Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:maxRetentionDays:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock applies to
--   the selected backup vault. If <tt>true</tt>, Vault Lock prevents
--   delete and update operations on the recovery points in the selected
--   vault.
[$sel:locked:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Bool

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
[$sel:creatorRequestId:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.
[$sel:numberOfRecoveryPoints:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionKeyArn:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a resource backup is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention
--   period.
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the
--   minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter
--   than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or
--   copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use
--   a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior
--   to Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:minRetentionDays:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupVaultListMember</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lockDate:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_lockDate</a> - The date and time when Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration becomes immutable, meaning it cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock
--   from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRetentionDays:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,

--   <a>backupVaultListMember_encryptionKeyArn</a> - The server-side
--   encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_creationDate</a> - The date and time a
--   resource backup is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal
--   Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical

--   to Vault Lock are not affected.

--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
backupVaultListMember_lockDate :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe UTCTime)

module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle

-- | Contains <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt>
--   timestamps, which are used to specify a lifecycle for a recovery
--   point.
--   
--   The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCalculatedLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data CalculatedLifecycle
CalculatedLifecycle' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CalculatedLifecycle

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to delete a recovery point.
[$sel:deleteAt:CalculatedLifecycle'] :: CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:moveToColdStorageAt:CalculatedLifecycle'] :: CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CalculatedLifecycle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAt:CalculatedLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>calculatedLifecycle_deleteAt</a> - A timestamp that specifies when
--   to delete a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moveToColdStorageAt:CalculatedLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>calculatedLifecycle_moveToColdStorageAt</a> - A timestamp that
--   specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold storage.
newCalculatedLifecycle :: CalculatedLifecycle

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to delete a recovery point.
calculatedLifecycle_deleteAt :: Lens' CalculatedLifecycle (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold
--   storage.
calculatedLifecycle_moveToColdStorageAt :: Lens' CalculatedLifecycle (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle.CalculatedLifecycle
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle.CalculatedLifecycle
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle.CalculatedLifecycle
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle.CalculatedLifecycle
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle.CalculatedLifecycle
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle.CalculatedLifecycle
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CalculatedLifecycle.CalculatedLifecycle


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType
newtype ConditionType
ConditionType' :: Text -> ConditionType
[fromConditionType] :: ConditionType -> Text
pattern ConditionType_STRINGEQUALS :: ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ConditionType.ConditionType


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition

-- | Contains an array of triplets made up of a condition type (such as
--   <tt>StringEquals</tt>), a key, and a value. Conditions are used to
--   filter resources in a selection that is assigned to a backup plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: ConditionType -> Text -> Text -> Condition

-- | An operation, such as <tt>StringEquals</tt>, that is applied to a
--   key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.
[$sel:conditionType:Condition'] :: Condition -> ConditionType

-- | The key in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department"</tt> is the key.
[$sel:conditionKey:Condition'] :: Condition -> Text

-- | The value in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"accounting"</tt> is the value.
[$sel:conditionValue:Condition'] :: Condition -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionType:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionType</a> -
--   An operation, such as <tt>StringEquals</tt>, that is applied to a
--   key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionKey:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionKey</a> -
--   The key in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department"</tt> is the key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionValue:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionValue</a>
--   - The value in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"accounting"</tt> is the value.
newCondition :: ConditionType -> Text -> Text -> Condition

-- | An operation, such as <tt>StringEquals</tt>, that is applied to a
--   key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.
condition_conditionType :: Lens' Condition ConditionType

-- | The key in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department"</tt> is the key.
condition_conditionKey :: Lens' Condition Text

-- | The value in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"accounting"</tt> is the value.
condition_conditionValue :: Lens' Condition Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Condition.Condition


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection

-- | Used to specify a set of resources to a backup plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupSelection</a> smart constructor.
data BackupSelection
BackupSelection' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Condition] -> Text -> Text -> BackupSelection

-- | An array of strings that contain Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of
--   resources to assign to a backup plan.
[$sel:resources:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of conditions used to specify a set of resources to assign to
--   a backup plan; for example, <tt>"StringEquals":
--   {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>. Assigns the backup
--   plan to every resource with at least one matching tag.
[$sel:listOfTags:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Maybe [Condition]

-- | The display name of a resource selection document.
[$sel:selectionName:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that Backup uses to authenticate when backing
--   up the target resource; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupSelection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_resources</a> - An array of strings that contain
--   Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of resources to assign to a backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listOfTags:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_listOfTags</a> - An array of conditions used to
--   specify a set of resources to assign to a backup plan; for example,
--   <tt>"StringEquals": {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>.
--   Assigns the backup plan to every resource with at least one matching
--   tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectionName:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_selectionName</a> - The display name of a resource
--   selection document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_iamRoleArn</a> - The ARN of the IAM role that
--   Backup uses to authenticate when backing up the target resource; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
newBackupSelection :: Text -> Text -> BackupSelection

-- | An array of strings that contain Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of
--   resources to assign to a backup plan.
backupSelection_resources :: Lens' BackupSelection (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of conditions used to specify a set of resources to assign to
--   a backup plan; for example, <tt>"StringEquals":
--   {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>. Assigns the backup
--   plan to every resource with at least one matching tag.
backupSelection_listOfTags :: Lens' BackupSelection (Maybe [Condition])

-- | The display name of a resource selection document.
backupSelection_selectionName :: Lens' BackupSelection Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that Backup uses to authenticate when backing
--   up the target resource; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
backupSelection_iamRoleArn :: Lens' BackupSelection Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupSelection.BackupSelection


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter

-- | A list of parameters for a control. A control can have zero, one, or
--   more than one parameter. An example of a control with two parameters
--   is: "backup plan frequency is at least <tt>daily</tt> and the
--   retention period is at least <tt>1 year</tt>". The first parameter is
--   <tt>daily</tt>. The second parameter is <tt>1 year</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newControlInputParameter</a> smart constructor.
data ControlInputParameter
ControlInputParameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ControlInputParameter

-- | The value of parameter, for example, <tt>hourly</tt>.
[$sel:parameterValue:ControlInputParameter'] :: ControlInputParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a parameter, for example, <tt>BackupPlanFrequency</tt>.
[$sel:parameterName:ControlInputParameter'] :: ControlInputParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ControlInputParameter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:ControlInputParameter'</a>,
--   <a>controlInputParameter_parameterValue</a> - The value of parameter,
--   for example, <tt>hourly</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:ControlInputParameter'</a>,
--   <a>controlInputParameter_parameterName</a> - The name of a parameter,
--   for example, <tt>BackupPlanFrequency</tt>.
newControlInputParameter :: ControlInputParameter

-- | The value of parameter, for example, <tt>hourly</tt>.
controlInputParameter_parameterValue :: Lens' ControlInputParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a parameter, for example, <tt>BackupPlanFrequency</tt>.
controlInputParameter_parameterName :: Lens' ControlInputParameter (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlInputParameter.ControlInputParameter


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope

-- | A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control has its own
--   control scope. The control scope defines what the control will
--   evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans.
--   
--   To set a control scope that includes all of a particular resource,
--   leave the <tt>ControlScope</tt> empty or do not pass it when calling
--   <tt>CreateFramework</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newControlScope</a> smart constructor.
data ControlScope
ControlScope' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> ControlScope

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes one or more types of
--   resources, such as <tt>EFS</tt> or <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:complianceResourceTypes:ControlScope'] :: ControlScope -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes resources with one or
--   more tags. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:tags:ControlScope'] :: ControlScope -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The ID of the only Amazon Web Services resource that you want your
--   control scope to contain.
[$sel:complianceResourceIds:ControlScope'] :: ControlScope -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>ControlScope</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceResourceTypes:ControlScope'</a>,
--   <a>controlScope_complianceResourceTypes</a> - Describes whether the
--   control scope includes one or more types of resources, such as
--   <tt>EFS</tt> or <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ControlScope'</a>, <a>controlScope_tags</a> - Describes
--   whether the control scope includes resources with one or more tags.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceResourceIds:ControlScope'</a>,
--   <a>controlScope_complianceResourceIds</a> - The ID of the only Amazon
--   Web Services resource that you want your control scope to contain.
newControlScope :: ControlScope

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes one or more types of
--   resources, such as <tt>EFS</tt> or <tt>RDS</tt>.
controlScope_complianceResourceTypes :: Lens' ControlScope (Maybe [Text])

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes resources with one or
--   more tags. Each tag is a key-value pair.
controlScope_tags :: Lens' ControlScope (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The ID of the only Amazon Web Services resource that you want your
--   control scope to contain.
controlScope_complianceResourceIds :: Lens' ControlScope (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ControlScope.ControlScope

CopyJobState' :: Text -> CopyJobState
[fromCopyJobState] :: CopyJobState -> Text
pattern CopyJobState_COMPLETED :: CopyJobState

pattern CopyJobState_RUNNING :: CopyJobState

instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJobState.CopyJobState


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework

-- | Contains detailed information about a framework. Frameworks contain
--   controls, which evaluate and report on your backup events and
--   resources. Frameworks generate daily compliance results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFramework</a> smart constructor.
data Framework
Framework' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Framework

-- | The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationTime:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An optional description of the framework with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
[$sel:frameworkDescription:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of controls contained by the framework.
[$sel:numberOfControls:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Int

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:frameworkArn:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | The deployment status of a framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
[$sel:deploymentStatus:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
[$sel:frameworkName:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Framework</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkDescription:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_frameworkDescription</a> - An optional description of the
--   framework with a maximum 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfControls:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_numberOfControls</a> - The number of controls contained
--   by the framework.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkArn:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_frameworkArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentStatus:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_deploymentStatus</a> - The deployment status of a
--   framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkName:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_frameworkName</a> -
--   The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
newFramework :: Framework

-- | The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
framework_creationTime :: Lens' Framework (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An optional description of the framework with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
framework_frameworkDescription :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of controls contained by the framework.
framework_numberOfControls :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Int)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
framework_frameworkArn :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment status of a framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
framework_deploymentStatus :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
framework_frameworkName :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework.Framework
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework.Framework
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework.Framework
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework.Framework
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework.Framework
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework.Framework
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Framework.Framework


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl

-- | Contains detailed information about all of the controls of a
--   framework. Each framework must contain at least one control.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFrameworkControl</a> smart constructor.
data FrameworkControl
FrameworkControl' :: Maybe ControlScope -> Maybe [ControlInputParameter] -> Text -> FrameworkControl

-- | The scope of a control. The control scope defines what the control
--   will evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans. For
--   more information, see <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
[$sel:controlScope:FrameworkControl'] :: FrameworkControl -> Maybe ControlScope

-- | A list of <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
[$sel:controlInputParameters:FrameworkControl'] :: FrameworkControl -> Maybe [ControlInputParameter]

-- | The name of a control. This name is between 1 and 256 characters.
[$sel:controlName:FrameworkControl'] :: FrameworkControl -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FrameworkControl</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlScope:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlScope</a> - The scope of a control. The
--   control scope defines what the control will evaluate. Three examples
--   of control scopes are: a specific backup plan, all backup plans with a
--   specific tag, or all backup plans. For more information, see
--   <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlInputParameters:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlInputParameters</a> - A list of
--   <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlName:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlName</a> - The name of a control. This name
--   is between 1 and 256 characters.
newFrameworkControl :: Text -> FrameworkControl

-- | The scope of a control. The control scope defines what the control
--   will evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans. For
--   more information, see <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
frameworkControl_controlScope :: Lens' FrameworkControl (Maybe ControlScope)

-- | A list of <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
frameworkControl_controlInputParameters :: Lens' FrameworkControl (Maybe [ControlInputParameter])

-- | The name of a control. This name is between 1 and 256 characters.
frameworkControl_controlName :: Lens' FrameworkControl Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.FrameworkControl.FrameworkControl


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle

-- | Contains an array of <tt>Transition</tt> objects specifying how long
--   in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is
--   deleted.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, on the console, the “expire after
--   days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold
--   after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting
--   cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data Lifecycle
Lifecycle' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Lifecycle

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   moved to cold storage.
[$sel:moveToColdStorageAfterDays:Lifecycle'] :: Lifecycle -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
[$sel:deleteAfterDays:Lifecycle'] :: Lifecycle -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Lifecycle</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:moveToColdStorageAfterDays:Lifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycle_moveToColdStorageAfterDays</a> - Specifies the number of
--   days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAfterDays:Lifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycle_deleteAfterDays</a> - Specifies the number of days after
--   creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90
--   days plus <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
newLifecycle :: Lifecycle

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   moved to cold storage.
lifecycle_moveToColdStorageAfterDays :: Lens' Lifecycle (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
lifecycle_deleteAfterDays :: Lens' Lifecycle (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.Lifecycle.Lifecycle


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction

-- | The details of the copy operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyAction</a> smart constructor.
data CopyAction
CopyAction' :: Maybe Lifecycle -> Text -> CopyAction
[$sel:lifecycle:CopyAction'] :: CopyAction -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the destination
--   backup vault for the copied backup. For example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:destinationBackupVaultArn:CopyAction'] :: CopyAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:CopyAction'</a>, <a>copyAction_lifecycle</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationBackupVaultArn:CopyAction'</a>,
--   <a>copyAction_destinationBackupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies the destination backup vault for the
--   copied backup. For example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
newCopyAction :: Text -> CopyAction

-- | Undocumented member.
copyAction_lifecycle :: Lens' CopyAction (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the destination
--   backup vault for the copied backup. For example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
copyAction_destinationBackupVaultArn :: Lens' CopyAction Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyAction.CopyAction


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRuleInput

-- | Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRuleInput</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRuleInput
BackupRuleInput' :: Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [CopyAction] -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> BackupRuleInput

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A CRON expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job.
[$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
[$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
[$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Integer

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
[$sel:copyActions:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe [CopyAction]

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
[$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Integer

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
[$sel:ruleName:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRuleInput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_lifecycle</a> - The lifecycle defines when a
--   protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it
--   expires. Backup will transition and expire backups automatically
--   according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_recoveryPointTags</a> - To help organize your
--   resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you
--   create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_scheduleExpression</a> - A CRON expression in UTC
--   specifying when Backup initiates a backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_enableContinuousBackup</a> - Specifies whether
--   Backup creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create
--   continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or
--   not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_completionWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes
--   after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed
--   or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyActions:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_copyActions</a> - An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt>
--   objects, which contains the details of the copy operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_startWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start
--   successfully. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleName:BackupRuleInput'</a>, <a>backupRuleInput_ruleName</a>
--   - An optional display name for a backup rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_targetBackupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newBackupRuleInput :: Text -> Text -> BackupRuleInput

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
backupRuleInput_lifecycle :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
backupRuleInput_recoveryPointTags :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A CRON expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job.
backupRuleInput_scheduleExpression :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
backupRuleInput_enableContinuousBackup :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
backupRuleInput_completionWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Integer)

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
backupRuleInput_copyActions :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe [CopyAction])

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
backupRuleInput_startWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Integer)

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
backupRuleInput_ruleName :: Lens' BackupRuleInput Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
backupRuleInput_targetBackupVaultName :: Lens' BackupRuleInput Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRuleInput.BackupRuleInput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRuleInput.BackupRuleInput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRuleInput.BackupRuleInput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRuleInput.BackupRuleInput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRuleInput.BackupRuleInput
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRuleInput.BackupRuleInput


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlanInput

-- | Contains an optional backup plan display name and an array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a backup rule.
--   Each rule in a backup plan is a separate scheduled task.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupPlanInput</a> smart constructor.
data BackupPlanInput
BackupPlanInput' :: Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting] -> Text -> [BackupRuleInput] -> BackupPlanInput

-- | Specifies a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
--   These settings are only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backup jobs.
[$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlanInput'] :: BackupPlanInput -> Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting]

-- | The optional display name of a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlanInput'] :: BackupPlanInput -> Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
[$sel:rules:BackupPlanInput'] :: BackupPlanInput -> [BackupRuleInput]

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupPlanInput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlanInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlanInput_advancedBackupSettings</a> - Specifies a list of
--   <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type. These settings are only
--   available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlanInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlanInput_backupPlanName</a> - The optional display name of a
--   backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:BackupPlanInput'</a>, <a>backupPlanInput_rules</a> - An
--   array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
newBackupPlanInput :: Text -> BackupPlanInput

-- | Specifies a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
--   These settings are only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backup jobs.
backupPlanInput_advancedBackupSettings :: Lens' BackupPlanInput (Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting])

-- | The optional display name of a backup plan.
backupPlanInput_backupPlanName :: Lens' BackupPlanInput Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
backupPlanInput_rules :: Lens' BackupPlanInput [BackupRuleInput]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlanInput.BackupPlanInput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlanInput.BackupPlanInput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlanInput.BackupPlanInput
