instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlanInput.BackupPlanInput
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlanInput.BackupPlanInput


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRule

-- | Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRule</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRule
BackupRule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [CopyAction] -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> BackupRule

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a
--   selection of resources.
[$sel:ruleId:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that
--   are associated with this rule when restored from backup.
[$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job. For more information about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule
--   Expressions for Rules</a> in the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User
--   Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a value for this parameter, we
--   recommend testing your cron expression using one of the many available
--   cron generator and testing tools.
[$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
[$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
[$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Integer

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
[$sel:copyActions:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe [CopyAction]

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
[$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Integer

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
[$sel:ruleName:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleId:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_ruleId</a> - Uniquely
--   identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a selection
--   of resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_lifecycle</a> - The
--   lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold
--   storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups
--   automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_recoveryPointTags</a> - An array of key-value pair
--   strings that are assigned to resources that are associated with this
--   rule when restored from backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_scheduleExpression</a> - A cron expression in UTC
--   specifying when Backup initiates a backup job. For more information
--   about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule Expressions for Rules</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a
--   value for this parameter, we recommend testing your cron expression
--   using one of the many available cron generator and testing tools.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_enableContinuousBackup</a> - Specifies whether Backup
--   creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create continuous
--   backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or not
--   specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_completionWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it
--   will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyActions:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_copyActions</a> -
--   An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_startWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start
--   successfully. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleName:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_ruleName</a> - An
--   optional display name for a backup rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_targetBackupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newBackupRule :: Text -> Text -> BackupRule

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a
--   selection of resources.
backupRule_ruleId :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
backupRule_lifecycle :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that
--   are associated with this rule when restored from backup.
backupRule_recoveryPointTags :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job. For more information about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule
--   Expressions for Rules</a> in the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User
--   Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a value for this parameter, we
--   recommend testing your cron expression using one of the many available
--   cron generator and testing tools.
backupRule_scheduleExpression :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
backupRule_enableContinuousBackup :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
backupRule_completionWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Integer)

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
backupRule_copyActions :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe [CopyAction])

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
backupRule_startWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Integer)

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
backupRule_ruleName :: Lens' BackupRule Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
backupRule_targetBackupVaultName :: Lens' BackupRule Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRule.BackupRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRule.BackupRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRule.BackupRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRule.BackupRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRule.BackupRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupRule.BackupRule


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlan

-- | Contains an optional backup plan display name and an array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a backup rule.
--   Each rule in a backup plan is a separate scheduled task and can back
--   up a different selection of Amazon Web Services resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupPlan</a> smart constructor.
data BackupPlan
BackupPlan' :: Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting] -> Text -> [BackupRule] -> BackupPlan

-- | Contains a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
[$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlan'] :: BackupPlan -> Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting]

-- | The display name of a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlan'] :: BackupPlan -> Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
[$sel:rules:BackupPlan'] :: BackupPlan -> [BackupRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupPlan</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlan_advancedBackupSettings</a> - Contains a list of
--   <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlan_backupPlanName</a> - The display name of a backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:BackupPlan'</a>, <a>backupPlan_rules</a> - An array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a scheduled task
--   that is used to back up a selection of resources.
newBackupPlan :: Text -> BackupPlan

-- | Contains a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
backupPlan_advancedBackupSettings :: Lens' BackupPlan (Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting])

-- | The display name of a backup plan.
backupPlan_backupPlanName :: Lens' BackupPlan Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
backupPlan_rules :: Lens' BackupPlan [BackupRule]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlan.BackupPlan
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlan.BackupPlan
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlan.BackupPlan
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlan.BackupPlan
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlan.BackupPlan
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupPlan.BackupPlan


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource

-- | A structure that contains information about a backed-up resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectedResource</a> smart constructor.
data ProtectedResource
ProtectedResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ProtectedResource

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:ProtectedResource'] :: ProtectedResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a resource was last backed up, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastBackupTime:ProtectedResource'] :: ProtectedResource -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:ProtectedResource'] :: ProtectedResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtectedResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_resourceType</a> - The type of Amazon Web
--   Services resource; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon
--   EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
--   database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the
--   only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastBackupTime:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_lastBackupTime</a> - The date and time a resource
--   was last backed up, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_resourceArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on
--   the resource type.
newProtectedResource :: ProtectedResource

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
protectedResource_resourceType :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time a resource was last backed up, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
protectedResource_lastBackupTime :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
protectedResource_resourceArn :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource.ProtectedResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource.ProtectedResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource.ProtectedResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource.ProtectedResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource.ProtectedResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource.ProtectedResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ProtectedResource.ProtectedResource


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator

-- | Contains information about the backup plan and rule that Backup used
--   to initiate the recovery point backup.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecoveryPointCreator</a> smart constructor.
data RecoveryPointCreator
RecoveryPointCreator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RecoveryPointCreator

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanId:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
[$sel:backupPlanArn:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | Version IDs are unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded
--   strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.
[$sel:backupPlanVersion:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule used to schedule the backup of a selection
--   of resources.
[$sel:backupRuleId:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecoveryPointCreator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanId:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanId</a> - Uniquely identifies a
--   backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanArn:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanVersion:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanVersion</a> - Version IDs are
--   unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at
--   most 1,024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRuleId:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupRuleId</a> - Uniquely identifies a rule
--   used to schedule the backup of a selection of resources.
newRecoveryPointCreator :: RecoveryPointCreator

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanId :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)

-- | Version IDs are unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded
--   strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.
recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanVersion :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule used to schedule the backup of a selection
--   of resources.
recoveryPointCreator_backupRuleId :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator.RecoveryPointCreator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator.RecoveryPointCreator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator.RecoveryPointCreator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator.RecoveryPointCreator
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator.RecoveryPointCreator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator.RecoveryPointCreator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointCreator.RecoveryPointCreator


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.CopyJob

-- | Contains detailed information about a copy job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyJob</a> smart constructor.
data CopyJob
CopyJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CopyJobState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CopyJob

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to copy the target recovery point; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of a copy job.
[$sel:state:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe CopyJobState

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a source recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:sourceRecoveryPointArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
[$sel:resourceType:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a destination
--   copy vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:destinationBackupVaultArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text
[$sel:createdBy:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a destination recovery point; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:destinationRecoveryPointArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID that owns the copy job.
[$sel:accountId:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a source copy
--   vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a copy job.
[$sel:copyJobId:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
[$sel:resourceArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to copy a
--   resource.
[$sel:statusMessage:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a copy job.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a copy job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a copy job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:completionDate:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   of a copy job.

--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_resourceType</a> - The
--   type of Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an

--   date and time a copy job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated

--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

--   The date and time a copy job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
newCopyJob :: CopyJob

--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.

--   resource.

module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob

-- | Contains detailed information about a backup job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupJob</a> smart constructor.
data BackupJob
BackupJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupJobState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> BackupJob

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point.
--   IAM roles other than the default role must include either
--   <tt>AWSBackup</tt> or <tt>AwsBackup</tt> in the role name. For
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess</tt>.
--   Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup
--   jobs.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of a resource recovery point.
[$sel:state:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe BackupJobState

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is
--   Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
[$sel:percentDone:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:startBy:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
[$sel:createdBy:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | The date and time a job to back up resources is expected to be
--   completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The
--   value of <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:expectedCompletionDate:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the
--   job status was queried.
[$sel:bytesTransferred:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID that owns the backup job.
[$sel:accountId:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
[$sel:backupJobId:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a
--   resource.
[$sel:statusMessage:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Represents the type of backup for a backup job.
[$sel:backupType:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. If you
--   specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
[$sel:backupOptions:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_iamRoleArn</a> -
--   Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point.
--   IAM roles other than the default role must include either
--   <tt>AWSBackup</tt> or <tt>AwsBackup</tt> in the role name. For
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess</tt>.
--   Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_state</a> - The current
--   state of a resource recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_resourceType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is
--   Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentDone:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_percentDone</a> -
--   Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startBy:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_startBy</a> - Specifies
--   the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a
--   backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_createdBy</a> -
--   Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedCompletionDate:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_expectedCompletionDate</a> - The date and time a job to
--   back up resources is expected to be completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesTransferred:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_bytesTransferred</a> - The size in bytes transferred to a
--   backup vault at the time that the job status was queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupVaultArn</a>
--   - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup
--   vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_accountId</a> - The
--   account ID that owns the backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupJobId:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupJobId</a> -
--   Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_resourceArn</a> - An
--   ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends
--   on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_statusMessage</a> -
--   A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_recoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely identifies a
--   recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_creationDate</a> -
--   The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_completionDate</a>
--   - The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical container
--   where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that
--   are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web
--   Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase
--   letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupType:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupType</a> -
--   Represents the type of backup for a backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupOptions</a> -
--   Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. If you
--   specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
newBackupJob :: BackupJob

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point.
--   IAM roles other than the default role must include either
--   <tt>AWSBackup</tt> or <tt>AwsBackup</tt> in the role name. For
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess</tt>.
--   Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup
--   jobs.
backupJob_iamRoleArn :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of a resource recovery point.
backupJob_state :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe BackupJobState)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is
--   Amazon EC2.
backupJob_resourceType :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
backupJob_percentDone :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
backupJob_startBy :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
backupJob_createdBy :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe RecoveryPointCreator)

-- | The date and time a job to back up resources is expected to be
--   completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The
--   value of <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
backupJob_expectedCompletionDate :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the
--   job status was queried.
backupJob_bytesTransferred :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Integer)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
backupJob_backupVaultArn :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID that owns the backup job.
backupJob_accountId :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
backupJob_backupJobId :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
backupJob_resourceArn :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a
--   resource.
backupJob_statusMessage :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
backupJob_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
backupJob_backupSizeInBytes :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
backupJob_creationDate :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
backupJob_completionDate :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
backupJob_backupVaultName :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the type of backup for a backup job.
backupJob_backupType :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. If you
--   specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
backupJob_backupOptions :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob.BackupJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob.BackupJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob.BackupJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob.BackupJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob.BackupJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob.BackupJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.BackupJob.BackupJob


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointStatus
newtype RecoveryPointStatus
RecoveryPointStatus' :: Text -> RecoveryPointStatus
[fromRecoveryPointStatus] :: RecoveryPointStatus -> Text
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_COMPLETED :: RecoveryPointStatus
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_DELETING :: RecoveryPointStatus
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_EXPIRED :: RecoveryPointStatus
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_PARTIAL :: RecoveryPointStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointStatus.RecoveryPointStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointStatus.RecoveryPointStatus

module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByResource

-- | Contains detailed information about a saved recovery point.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecoveryPointByResource</a> smart constructor.
data RecoveryPointByResource
RecoveryPointByResource' :: Maybe RecoveryPointStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> RecoveryPointByResource

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
[$sel:status:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus

-- | A message explaining the reason of the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
[$sel:statusMessage:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
[$sel:backupSizeBytes:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe Integer

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionKeyArn:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecoveryPointByResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   of a backup.

module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault

-- | Contains detailed information about the recovery points stored in a
--   backup vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecoveryPointByBackupVault</a> smart constructor.
data RecoveryPointByBackupVault
RecoveryPointByBackupVault' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> RecoveryPointByBackupVault

-- | A Boolean value that is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified
--   recovery point is encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point
--   is not encrypted.
[$sel:isEncrypted:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Bool

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
[$sel:status:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource saved as a recovery point;
--   for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an
--   Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource
--   type is Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery
--   point, including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
[$sel:createdBy:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | A <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
[$sel:calculatedLifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe CalculatedLifecycle

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The backup vault where the recovery point was originally copied from.
--   If the recovery point is restored to the same account this value will
--   be <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format
--   and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:lastRestoreTime:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | A message explaining the reason of the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
[$sel:statusMessage:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionKeyArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a job to restore a recovery point is completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecoveryPointByBackupVault</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEncrypted:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_isEncrypted</a> - A Boolean value that
--   is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified recovery point is
--   encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point is not encrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_status</a> - A status code specifying
--   the state of the recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM role
--   ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceType</a> - The type of Amazon
--   Web Services resource saved as a recovery point; for example, an
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational

--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
--

--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_createdBy</a> - Contains identifying
--   information about the creation of a recovery point, including the
--   <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:calculatedLifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_calculatedLifecycle</a> - A
--   <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_lifecycle</a> - The lifecycle defines
--   when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it
--   expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically
--   according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultArn</a> - An ARN that
--   uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_sourceBackupVaultArn</a> - The backup
--   vault where the recovery point was originally copied from. If the
--   recovery point is restored to the same account this value will be
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRestoreTime:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_lastRestoreTime</a> - The date and time
--   a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_statusMessage</a> - A message explaining
--   the reason of the recovery point deletion failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_recoveryPointArn</a> - An Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionKeyArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_encryptionKeyArn</a> - The server-side
--   encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in
--   bytes, of a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_creationDate</a> - The date and time a
--   recovery point is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal
--   Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_completionDate</a> - The date and time a
--   job to restore a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They
--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newRecoveryPointByBackupVault :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault

-- | A Boolean value that is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified
--   recovery point is encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point
--   is not encrypted.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_isEncrypted :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Bool)

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_status :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe RecoveryPointStatus)

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_iamRoleArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource saved as a recovery point;
--   for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an
--   Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource
--   type is Amazon EC2.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceType :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery
--   point, including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_createdBy :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe RecoveryPointCreator)

-- | A <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_calculatedLifecycle :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe CalculatedLifecycle)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_lifecycle :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The backup vault where the recovery point was originally copied from.
--   If the recovery point is restored to the same account this value will
--   be <tt>null</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_sourceBackupVaultArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format
--   and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_lastRestoreTime :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | A message explaining the reason of the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_statusMessage :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_encryptionKeyArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupSizeInBytes :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_creationDate :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time a job to restore a recovery point is completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_completionDate :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultName :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointByBackupVault
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointByBackupVault
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointByBackupVault
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointByBackupVault
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointByBackupVault
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointByBackupVault
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointByBackupVault


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | Contains information from your report plan about where to deliver your
--   reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and
--   the formats of your reports.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportDeliveryChannel</a> smart constructor.
data ReportDeliveryChannel
ReportDeliveryChannel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | The prefix for where Backup Audit Manager delivers your reports to
--   Amazon S3. The prefix is this part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:ReportDeliveryChannel'] :: ReportDeliveryChannel -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the format of your reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or
--   both. If not specified, the default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.
[$sel:formats:ReportDeliveryChannel'] :: ReportDeliveryChannel -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The unique name of the S3 bucket that receives your reports.
[$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDeliveryChannel'] :: ReportDeliveryChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportDeliveryChannel</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:ReportDeliveryChannel'</a>,
--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_s3KeyPrefix</a> - The prefix for where Backup
--   Audit Manager delivers your reports to Amazon S3. The prefix is this
--   part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:formats:ReportDeliveryChannel'</a>,
--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_formats</a> - A list of the format of your
--   reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or both. If not specified, the
--   default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDeliveryChannel'</a>,
--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_s3BucketName</a> - The unique name of the S3
--   bucket that receives your reports.
newReportDeliveryChannel :: Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | The prefix for where Backup Audit Manager delivers your reports to
--   Amazon S3. The prefix is this part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
reportDeliveryChannel_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the format of your reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or
--   both. If not specified, the default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.
reportDeliveryChannel_formats :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel (Maybe [Text])

-- | The unique name of the S3 bucket that receives your reports.
reportDeliveryChannel_s3BucketName :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDeliveryChannel.ReportDeliveryChannel


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportDestination

--   destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportDestination</a> smart constructor.
data ReportDestination
ReportDestination' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> ReportDestination

-- | The object key that uniquely identifies your reports in your S3
--   bucket.
[$sel:s3Keys:ReportDestination'] :: ReportDestination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The unique name of the Amazon S3 bucket that receives your reports.
[$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDestination'] :: ReportDestination -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Keys:ReportDestination'</a>, <a>reportDestination_s3Keys</a>
--   - The object key that uniquely identifies your reports in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDestination'</a>,
--   <a>reportDestination_s3BucketName</a> - The unique name of the Amazon
--   S3 bucket that receives your reports.
newReportDestination :: ReportDestination

-- | The object key that uniquely identifies your reports in your S3
--   bucket.
reportDestination_s3Keys :: Lens' ReportDestination (Maybe [Text])

-- | The unique name of the Amazon S3 bucket that receives your reports.
