module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob

-- | Contains detailed information about a report job. A report job
--   compiles a report based on a report plan and publishes it to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportJob</a> smart constructor.
data ReportJob
ReportJob' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportDestination -> Maybe Text -> ReportJob

-- | The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationTime:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The status of a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.
[$sel:status:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:completionTime:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated,
--   Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report
--   job IDs cannot be edited.
[$sel:reportJobId:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A message explaining the status of the report job.
[$sel:statusMessage:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The S3 bucket name and S3 keys for the destination where the report
--   job publishes the report.
[$sel:reportDestination:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe ReportDestination

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
[$sel:reportTemplate:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_status</a> - The status of
--   a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportPlanArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_completionTime</a>
--   - The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportJobId:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportJobId</a> - The
--   identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated, Unicode,
--   UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report job IDs
--   cannot be edited.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_statusMessage</a> -
--   A message explaining the status of the report job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDestination:ReportJob'</a>,
--   <a>reportJob_reportDestination</a> - The S3 bucket name and S3 keys
--   for the destination where the report job publishes the report.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportTemplate:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportTemplate</a>
--   - Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built
--   using a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
newReportJob :: ReportJob

-- | The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportJob_creationTime :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.
reportJob_status :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
reportJob_reportPlanArn :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportJob_completionTime :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated,
--   Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report
--   job IDs cannot be edited.
reportJob_reportJobId :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A message explaining the status of the report job.
reportJob_statusMessage :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 bucket name and S3 keys for the destination where the report
--   job publishes the report.
reportJob_reportDestination :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe ReportDestination)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
reportJob_reportTemplate :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob.ReportJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob.ReportJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob.ReportJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob.ReportJob
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob.ReportJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob.ReportJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportJob.ReportJob


module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportSetting

-- | Contains detailed information about a report setting.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportSetting</a> smart constructor.
data ReportSetting
ReportSetting' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ReportSetting

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the frameworks a report covers.
[$sel:frameworkArns:ReportSetting'] :: ReportSetting -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The number of frameworks a report covers.
[$sel:numberOfFrameworks:ReportSetting'] :: ReportSetting -> Maybe Int

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
[$sel:reportTemplate:ReportSetting'] :: ReportSetting -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportSetting</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkArns:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_frameworkArns</a> - The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   of the frameworks a report covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfFrameworks:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_numberOfFrameworks</a> - The number of frameworks a
--   report covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportTemplate:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_reportTemplate</a> - Identifies the report template
--   for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report
--   templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
newReportSetting :: Text -> ReportSetting

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the frameworks a report covers.
reportSetting_frameworkArns :: Lens' ReportSetting (Maybe [Text])

-- | The number of frameworks a report covers.
reportSetting_numberOfFrameworks :: Lens' ReportSetting (Maybe Int)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
reportSetting_reportTemplate :: Lens' ReportSetting Text

module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.ReportPlan

-- | Contains detailed information about a report plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportPlan</a> smart constructor.
data ReportPlan
ReportPlan' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportSetting -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel -> ReportPlan

-- | The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationTime:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
[$sel:reportPlanName:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
[$sel:reportSetting:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe ReportSetting

-- | An optional description of the report plan with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
[$sel:reportPlanDescription:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan
--   last attempted to run, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastAttemptedExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastAttemptedExecutionTime:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The deployment status of a report plan. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED
--   </pre>
[$sel:deploymentStatus:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan
--   last successfully ran, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastSuccessfulExecutionTime</tt> is accurate
--   to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents
--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastSuccessfulExecutionTime:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Contains information about where and how to deliver your reports,
--   specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the
--   formats of your reports.
[$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportPlan</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ReportPlan'</a>, <a>reportPlan_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanName:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportPlanName</a> - The unique name of the report plan.
--   This name is between 1 and 256 characters starting with a letter, and
--   consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportPlan'</a>, <a>reportPlan_reportPlanArn</a>
--   - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource.
--   The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportSetting:ReportPlan'</a>, <a>reportPlan_reportSetting</a>
--   - Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built
--   using a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanDescription:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportPlanDescription</a> - An optional description of
--   the report plan with a maximum 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAttemptedExecutionTime:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_lastAttemptedExecutionTime</a> - The date and time that
--   a report job associated with this report plan last attempted to run,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastAttemptedExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentStatus:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_deploymentStatus</a> - The deployment status of a report
--   plan. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfulExecutionTime:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_lastSuccessfulExecutionTime</a> - The date and time that
--   a report job associated with this report plan last successfully ran,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastSuccessfulExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel</a> - Contains information about
--   where and how to deliver your reports, specifically your Amazon S3
--   bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the formats of your reports.
newReportPlan :: ReportPlan

-- | The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportPlan_creationTime :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe UTCTime)

--   characters starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
reportPlan_reportPlanName :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
reportPlan_reportPlanArn :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or

--   characters.
reportPlan_reportPlanDescription :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan

module Network.AWS.Backup.Types.RestoreJobsListMember

-- | Contains metadata about a restore job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreJobsListMember</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreJobsListMember
RestoreJobsListMember' :: Maybe RestoreJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> RestoreJobsListMember

-- | A status code specifying the state of the job initiated by Backup to
--   restore a recovery point.
[$sel:status:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe RestoreJobStatus

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is
--   expected to take.
[$sel:expectedCompletionTimeMinutes:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.
[$sel:restoreJobId:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource type of the listed restore jobs; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
[$sel:percentDone:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID that owns the restore job.
[$sel:accountId:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:createdResourceArn:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to restore a
--   recovery point.
[$sel:statusMessage:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the restored resource.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a restore job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a job to restore a recovery point is completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreJobsListMember</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_status</a> - A status code specifying the
--   state of the job initiated by Backup to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM role ARN
--   used to create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedCompletionTimeMinutes:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_expectedCompletionTimeMinutes</a> - The
--   amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is
--   expected to take.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restoreJobId:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_restoreJobId</a> - Uniquely identifies the
--   job that restores a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_resourceType</a> - The resource type of the
--   listed restore jobs; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store
--   (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon
--   RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups,
--   the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentDone:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_percentDone</a> - Contains an estimated
--   percentage complete of a job at the time the job status was queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_accountId</a> - The account ID that owns the
--   restore job.
--

--

--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_completionDate</a> - The date and time a job
--   to restore a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and

--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
newRestoreJobsListMember :: RestoreJobsListMember

--   restore a recovery point.

module Network.AWS.Backup.Types

-- | API version <tt>2018-11-15</tt> of the Amazon Backup SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For
--   example, a parameter is of the wrong type.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A dependent Amazon Web Services service or resource returned an error
--   to the Backup service, and the action cannot be completed.
_DependencyFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Backup is already performing an action on this recovery point. It
--   can't perform the action you requested until the first action
--   finishes. Try again later.
_InvalidResourceStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Backup can't perform the action that you requested until it finishes
--   performing a previous action. Try again later.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For
--   example, the value is out of range.
_InvalidParameterValueException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The required resource already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum
--   number of items allowed in a request.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
_MissingParameterValueException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype BackupJobState
BackupJobState' :: Text -> BackupJobState
[fromBackupJobState] :: BackupJobState -> Text
pattern BackupJobState_ABORTED :: BackupJobState
pattern BackupJobState_ABORTING :: BackupJobState
pattern BackupJobState_COMPLETED :: BackupJobState
pattern BackupJobState_CREATED :: BackupJobState
pattern BackupJobState_EXPIRED :: BackupJobState
pattern BackupJobState_FAILED :: BackupJobState
pattern BackupJobState_PENDING :: BackupJobState
pattern BackupJobState_RUNNING :: BackupJobState
newtype BackupVaultEvent
BackupVaultEvent' :: Text -> BackupVaultEvent
[fromBackupVaultEvent] :: BackupVaultEvent -> Text
pattern BackupVaultEvent_BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_BACKUP_JOB_EXPIRED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_BACKUP_JOB_FAILED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_BACKUP_JOB_STARTED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_BACKUP_JOB_SUCCESSFUL :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_BACKUP_PLAN_CREATED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_BACKUP_PLAN_MODIFIED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_COPY_JOB_FAILED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_COPY_JOB_STARTED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_COPY_JOB_SUCCESSFUL :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_RECOVERY_POINT_MODIFIED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_RESTORE_JOB_COMPLETED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_RESTORE_JOB_FAILED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_RESTORE_JOB_STARTED :: BackupVaultEvent
pattern BackupVaultEvent_RESTORE_JOB_SUCCESSFUL :: BackupVaultEvent
newtype ConditionType
ConditionType' :: Text -> ConditionType
[fromConditionType] :: ConditionType -> Text
pattern ConditionType_STRINGEQUALS :: ConditionType
newtype CopyJobState
CopyJobState' :: Text -> CopyJobState
[fromCopyJobState] :: CopyJobState -> Text
pattern CopyJobState_COMPLETED :: CopyJobState
pattern CopyJobState_CREATED :: CopyJobState
pattern CopyJobState_FAILED :: CopyJobState
pattern CopyJobState_RUNNING :: CopyJobState
newtype RecoveryPointStatus
RecoveryPointStatus' :: Text -> RecoveryPointStatus
[fromRecoveryPointStatus] :: RecoveryPointStatus -> Text
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_COMPLETED :: RecoveryPointStatus
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_DELETING :: RecoveryPointStatus
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_EXPIRED :: RecoveryPointStatus
pattern RecoveryPointStatus_PARTIAL :: RecoveryPointStatus
newtype RestoreJobStatus
RestoreJobStatus' :: Text -> RestoreJobStatus
[fromRestoreJobStatus] :: RestoreJobStatus -> Text
pattern RestoreJobStatus_ABORTED :: RestoreJobStatus
pattern RestoreJobStatus_COMPLETED :: RestoreJobStatus
pattern RestoreJobStatus_FAILED :: RestoreJobStatus
pattern RestoreJobStatus_PENDING :: RestoreJobStatus
pattern RestoreJobStatus_RUNNING :: RestoreJobStatus
newtype StorageClass
StorageClass' :: Text -> StorageClass
[fromStorageClass] :: StorageClass -> Text
pattern StorageClass_COLD :: StorageClass
pattern StorageClass_DELETED :: StorageClass
pattern StorageClass_WARM :: StorageClass

-- | A list of backup options for each resource type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdvancedBackupSetting</a> smart constructor.
data AdvancedBackupSetting
AdvancedBackupSetting' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> AdvancedBackupSetting

-- | Specifies an object containing resource type and backup options. The
--   only supported resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see
--   the <a>sample CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS</a> in the
--   <i>Backup User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>EC2</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:AdvancedBackupSetting'] :: AdvancedBackupSetting -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows VSS backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup.
--   The <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   If you specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
--   
--   For more information about Windows VSS backups, see <a>Creating a
--   VSS-Enabled Windows Backup</a>.
[$sel:backupOptions:AdvancedBackupSetting'] :: AdvancedBackupSetting -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>AdvancedBackupSetting</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:AdvancedBackupSetting'</a>,
--   <a>advancedBackupSetting_resourceType</a> - Specifies an object
--   containing resource type and backup options. The only supported
--   resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see the <a>sample
--   CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS</a> in the <i>Backup
--   User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>EC2</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:AdvancedBackupSetting'</a>,
--   <a>advancedBackupSetting_backupOptions</a> - Specifies the backup
--   option for a selected resource. This option is only available for
--   Windows VSS backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup.
--   The <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   If you specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
--   
--   For more information about Windows VSS backups, see <a>Creating a
--   VSS-Enabled Windows Backup</a>.
newAdvancedBackupSetting :: AdvancedBackupSetting

-- | Specifies an object containing resource type and backup options. The
--   only supported resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see
--   the <a>sample CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS</a> in the
--   <i>Backup User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>EC2</tt>.
advancedBackupSetting_resourceType :: Lens' AdvancedBackupSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows VSS backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup.
--   The <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   If you specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
--   
--   For more information about Windows VSS backups, see <a>Creating a
--   VSS-Enabled Windows Backup</a>.
advancedBackupSetting_backupOptions :: Lens' AdvancedBackupSetting (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Contains detailed information about a backup job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupJob</a> smart constructor.
data BackupJob
BackupJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupJobState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> BackupJob

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point.
--   IAM roles other than the default role must include either
--   <tt>AWSBackup</tt> or <tt>AwsBackup</tt> in the role name. For
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess</tt>.
--   Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup
--   jobs.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of a resource recovery point.
[$sel:state:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe BackupJobState

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is
--   Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
[$sel:percentDone:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:startBy:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
[$sel:createdBy:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | The date and time a job to back up resources is expected to be
--   completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The
--   value of <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:expectedCompletionDate:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the
--   job status was queried.
[$sel:bytesTransferred:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID that owns the backup job.
[$sel:accountId:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
[$sel:backupJobId:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a
--   resource.
[$sel:statusMessage:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Represents the type of backup for a backup job.
[$sel:backupType:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. If you
--   specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
[$sel:backupOptions:BackupJob'] :: BackupJob -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

newBackupJob :: BackupJob

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point.
--   IAM roles other than the default role must include either
--   <tt>AWSBackup</tt> or <tt>AwsBackup</tt> in the role name. For

--   specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
backupJob_backupOptions :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Contains an optional backup plan display name and an array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a backup rule.
--   Each rule in a backup plan is a separate scheduled task and can back
--   up a different selection of Amazon Web Services resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupPlan</a> smart constructor.
data BackupPlan
BackupPlan' :: Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting] -> Text -> [BackupRule] -> BackupPlan

-- | Contains a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
[$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlan'] :: BackupPlan -> Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting]

-- | The display name of a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlan'] :: BackupPlan -> Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
[$sel:rules:BackupPlan'] :: BackupPlan -> [BackupRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupPlan</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlan_advancedBackupSettings</a> - Contains a list of
--   <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlan_backupPlanName</a> - The display name of a backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:BackupPlan'</a>, <a>backupPlan_rules</a> - An array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a scheduled task
--   that is used to back up a selection of resources.
newBackupPlan :: Text -> BackupPlan

-- | Contains a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
backupPlan_advancedBackupSettings :: Lens' BackupPlan (Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting])

-- | The display name of a backup plan.
backupPlan_backupPlanName :: Lens' BackupPlan Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
backupPlan_rules :: Lens' BackupPlan [BackupRule]

-- | Contains an optional backup plan display name and an array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a backup rule.
--   Each rule in a backup plan is a separate scheduled task.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupPlanInput</a> smart constructor.
data BackupPlanInput
BackupPlanInput' :: Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting] -> Text -> [BackupRuleInput] -> BackupPlanInput

-- | Specifies a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
--   These settings are only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backup jobs.
[$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlanInput'] :: BackupPlanInput -> Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting]

-- | The optional display name of a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlanInput'] :: BackupPlanInput -> Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
[$sel:rules:BackupPlanInput'] :: BackupPlanInput -> [BackupRuleInput]

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupPlanInput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlanInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlanInput_advancedBackupSettings</a> - Specifies a list of
--   <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type. These settings are only
--   available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlanInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlanInput_backupPlanName</a> - The optional display name of a
--   backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:BackupPlanInput'</a>, <a>backupPlanInput_rules</a> - An
--   array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
newBackupPlanInput :: Text -> BackupPlanInput

-- | Specifies a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
--   These settings are only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backup jobs.
backupPlanInput_advancedBackupSettings :: Lens' BackupPlanInput (Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting])

-- | The optional display name of a backup plan.
backupPlanInput_backupPlanName :: Lens' BackupPlanInput Text

-- | An array of <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a
--   scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.
backupPlanInput_rules :: Lens' BackupPlanInput [BackupRuleInput]

-- | An object specifying metadata associated with a backup plan template.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupPlanTemplatesListMember</a> smart constructor.
data BackupPlanTemplatesListMember

[$sel:backupPlanTemplateName:BackupPlanTemplatesListMember'] :: BackupPlanTemplatesListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a stored backup plan template.
[$sel:backupPlanTemplateId:BackupPlanTemplatesListMember'] :: BackupPlanTemplatesListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupPlanTemplatesListMember</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Contains metadata about a backup plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupPlansListMember</a> smart constructor.
data BackupPlansListMember
BackupPlansListMember' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> BackupPlansListMember

-- | Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at
--   most 1,024 bytes long. Version IDs cannot be edited.
[$sel:versionId:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The display name of a saved backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains a list of <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for a resource type.
[$sel:advancedBackupSettings:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting]

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanId:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
[$sel:creatorRequestId:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
[$sel:backupPlanArn:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The last time a job to back up resources was run with this rule. A
--   date and time, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
--   The value of <tt>LastExecutionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastExecutionDate:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a resource backup plan is created, in Unix format
--   and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:creationDate:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a backup plan is deleted, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>DeletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:deletionDate:BackupPlansListMember'] :: BackupPlansListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupPlansListMember</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.

newBackupPlansListMember :: BackupPlansListMember

--   most 1,024 bytes long. Version IDs cannot be edited.

-- | Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRule</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRule
BackupRule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [CopyAction] -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> BackupRule

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a
--   selection of resources.
[$sel:ruleId:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that
--   are associated with this rule when restored from backup.
[$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job. For more information about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule
--   Expressions for Rules</a> in the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User
--   Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a value for this parameter, we
--   recommend testing your cron expression using one of the many available
--   cron generator and testing tools.
[$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
[$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
[$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Integer

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
[$sel:copyActions:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe [CopyAction]

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
[$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Maybe Integer

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
[$sel:ruleName:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRule'] :: BackupRule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleId:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_ruleId</a> - Uniquely
--   identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a selection
--   of resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_lifecycle</a> - The
--   lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold
--   storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups
--   automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_recoveryPointTags</a> - An array of key-value pair
--   strings that are assigned to resources that are associated with this
--   rule when restored from backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_scheduleExpression</a> - A cron expression in UTC
--   specifying when Backup initiates a backup job. For more information
--   about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule Expressions for Rules</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a
--   value for this parameter, we recommend testing your cron expression
--   using one of the many available cron generator and testing tools.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_enableContinuousBackup</a> - Specifies whether Backup
--   creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create continuous
--   backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or not
--   specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_completionWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it
--   will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyActions:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_copyActions</a> -
--   An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_startWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start
--   successfully. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleName:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_ruleName</a> - An
--   optional display name for a backup rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_targetBackupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newBackupRule :: Text -> Text -> BackupRule

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a
--   selection of resources.
backupRule_ruleId :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
backupRule_lifecycle :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that
--   are associated with this rule when restored from backup.
backupRule_recoveryPointTags :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job. For more information about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule
--   Expressions for Rules</a> in the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User
--   Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a value for this parameter, we
--   recommend testing your cron expression using one of the many available
--   cron generator and testing tools.
backupRule_scheduleExpression :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Text)

--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
backupRule_enableContinuousBackup :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Bool)

--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
backupRule_completionWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Integer)

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
backupRule_copyActions :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe [CopyAction])

--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
backupRule_startWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Integer)

backupRule_ruleName :: Lens' BackupRule Text

--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
backupRule_targetBackupVaultName :: Lens' BackupRule Text

-- | Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRuleInput</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRuleInput
BackupRuleInput' :: Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [CopyAction] -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> BackupRuleInput

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A CRON expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job.
[$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
[$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Bool

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
[$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Integer

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
[$sel:copyActions:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe [CopyAction]

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
[$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Maybe Integer

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
[$sel:ruleName:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRuleInput'] :: BackupRuleInput -> Text

--   <a>$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRuleInput'</a>,

--   Backup creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create
--   continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or

--   or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.

--   objects, which contains the details of the copy operation.

--   <a>$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_targetBackupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newBackupRuleInput :: Text -> Text -> BackupRuleInput

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
backupRuleInput_lifecycle :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
backupRuleInput_recoveryPointTags :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A CRON expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job.
backupRuleInput_scheduleExpression :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
backupRuleInput_enableContinuousBackup :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
backupRuleInput_completionWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Integer)

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
backupRuleInput_copyActions :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe [CopyAction])

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
backupRuleInput_startWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRuleInput (Maybe Integer)

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
backupRuleInput_ruleName :: Lens' BackupRuleInput Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
backupRuleInput_targetBackupVaultName :: Lens' BackupRuleInput Text

-- | Used to specify a set of resources to a backup plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupSelection</a> smart constructor.
data BackupSelection
BackupSelection' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Condition] -> Text -> Text -> BackupSelection

-- | An array of strings that contain Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of
--   resources to assign to a backup plan.
[$sel:resources:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of conditions used to specify a set of resources to assign to
--   a backup plan; for example, <tt>"StringEquals":
--   {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>. Assigns the backup
--   plan to every resource with at least one matching tag.
[$sel:listOfTags:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Maybe [Condition]

-- | The display name of a resource selection document.
[$sel:selectionName:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Text

-- | The ARN of the IAM role that Backup uses to authenticate when backing
--   up the target resource; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupSelection'] :: BackupSelection -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupSelection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:BackupSelection'</a>,

--   Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of resources to assign to a backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listOfTags:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_listOfTags</a> - An array of conditions used to
--   specify a set of resources to assign to a backup plan; for example,
--   <tt>"StringEquals": {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>.
--   Assigns the backup plan to every resource with at least one matching
--   tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectionName:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_selectionName</a> - The display name of a resource
--   selection document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_iamRoleArn</a> - The ARN of the IAM role that
--   Backup uses to authenticate when backing up the target resource; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
newBackupSelection :: Text -> Text -> BackupSelection

-- | An array of strings that contain Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of
--   resources to assign to a backup plan.
backupSelection_resources :: Lens' BackupSelection (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of conditions used to specify a set of resources to assign to
--   a backup plan; for example, <tt>"StringEquals":
--   {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>. Assigns the backup
--   plan to every resource with at least one matching tag.
backupSelection_listOfTags :: Lens' BackupSelection (Maybe [Condition])

backupSelection_selectionName :: Lens' BackupSelection Text

--   up the target resource; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
backupSelection_iamRoleArn :: Lens' BackupSelection Text

-- | Contains metadata about a backup vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupVaultListMember</a> smart constructor.
data BackupVaultListMember
BackupVaultListMember' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> BackupVaultListMember

-- | The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration becomes
--   immutable, meaning it cannot be changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock
--   from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lockDate:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention
--   period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite
--   storage).
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the
--   maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than
--   that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy
--   job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a
--   different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to
--   Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:maxRetentionDays:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock applies to
--   the selected backup vault. If <tt>true</tt>, Vault Lock prevents
--   delete and update operations on the recovery points in the selected
--   vault.
[$sel:locked:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Bool

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
[$sel:creatorRequestId:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.
[$sel:numberOfRecoveryPoints:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionKeyArn:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a resource backup is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention
--   period.
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the
--   minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter
--   than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or
--   copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use
--   a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior
--   to Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:minRetentionDays:BackupVaultListMember'] :: BackupVaultListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupVaultListMember</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
