-- | Contains <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt>
--   timestamps, which are used to specify a lifecycle for a recovery
--   point.
--   
--   The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCalculatedLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data CalculatedLifecycle
CalculatedLifecycle' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CalculatedLifecycle

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to delete a recovery point.
[$sel:deleteAt:CalculatedLifecycle'] :: CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:moveToColdStorageAt:CalculatedLifecycle'] :: CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CalculatedLifecycle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAt:CalculatedLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>calculatedLifecycle_deleteAt</a> - A timestamp that specifies when
--   to delete a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moveToColdStorageAt:CalculatedLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>calculatedLifecycle_moveToColdStorageAt</a> - A timestamp that
--   specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold storage.
newCalculatedLifecycle :: CalculatedLifecycle

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to delete a recovery point.
calculatedLifecycle_deleteAt :: Lens' CalculatedLifecycle (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp that specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold
--   storage.
calculatedLifecycle_moveToColdStorageAt :: Lens' CalculatedLifecycle (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains an array of triplets made up of a condition type (such as
--   <tt>StringEquals</tt>), a key, and a value. Conditions are used to
--   filter resources in a selection that is assigned to a backup plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: ConditionType -> Text -> Text -> Condition

-- | An operation, such as <tt>StringEquals</tt>, that is applied to a
--   key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.
[$sel:conditionType:Condition'] :: Condition -> ConditionType

-- | The key in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department"</tt> is the key.
[$sel:conditionKey:Condition'] :: Condition -> Text

-- | The value in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"accounting"</tt> is the value.
[$sel:conditionValue:Condition'] :: Condition -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionType:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionType</a> -
--   An operation, such as <tt>StringEquals</tt>, that is applied to a
--   key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionKey:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionKey</a> -
--   The key in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department"</tt> is the key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionValue:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionValue</a>
--   - The value in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"accounting"</tt> is the value.
newCondition :: ConditionType -> Text -> Text -> Condition

-- | An operation, such as <tt>StringEquals</tt>, that is applied to a
--   key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.
condition_conditionType :: Lens' Condition ConditionType

-- | The key in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department"</tt> is the key.
condition_conditionKey :: Lens' Condition Text

-- | The value in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"accounting"</tt> is the value.
condition_conditionValue :: Lens' Condition Text

-- | A list of parameters for a control. A control can have zero, one, or
--   more than one parameter. An example of a control with two parameters
--   is: "backup plan frequency is at least <tt>daily</tt> and the
--   retention period is at least <tt>1 year</tt>". The first parameter is
--   <tt>daily</tt>. The second parameter is <tt>1 year</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newControlInputParameter</a> smart constructor.
data ControlInputParameter
ControlInputParameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ControlInputParameter

-- | The value of parameter, for example, <tt>hourly</tt>.
[$sel:parameterValue:ControlInputParameter'] :: ControlInputParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of a parameter, for example, <tt>BackupPlanFrequency</tt>.
[$sel:parameterName:ControlInputParameter'] :: ControlInputParameter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ControlInputParameter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:ControlInputParameter'</a>,
--   <a>controlInputParameter_parameterValue</a> - The value of parameter,
--   for example, <tt>hourly</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:ControlInputParameter'</a>,
--   <a>controlInputParameter_parameterName</a> - The name of a parameter,
--   for example, <tt>BackupPlanFrequency</tt>.
newControlInputParameter :: ControlInputParameter

-- | The value of parameter, for example, <tt>hourly</tt>.
controlInputParameter_parameterValue :: Lens' ControlInputParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of a parameter, for example, <tt>BackupPlanFrequency</tt>.
controlInputParameter_parameterName :: Lens' ControlInputParameter (Maybe Text)

-- | A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control has its own
--   control scope. The control scope defines what the control will
--   evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans.
--   
--   To set a control scope that includes all of a particular resource,
--   leave the <tt>ControlScope</tt> empty or do not pass it when calling
--   <tt>CreateFramework</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newControlScope</a> smart constructor.
data ControlScope
ControlScope' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> ControlScope

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes one or more types of
--   resources, such as <tt>EFS</tt> or <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:complianceResourceTypes:ControlScope'] :: ControlScope -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes resources with one or
--   more tags. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:tags:ControlScope'] :: ControlScope -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The ID of the only Amazon Web Services resource that you want your
--   control scope to contain.
[$sel:complianceResourceIds:ControlScope'] :: ControlScope -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>ControlScope</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceResourceTypes:ControlScope'</a>,
--   <a>controlScope_complianceResourceTypes</a> - Describes whether the
--   control scope includes one or more types of resources, such as
--   <tt>EFS</tt> or <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ControlScope'</a>, <a>controlScope_tags</a> - Describes
--   whether the control scope includes resources with one or more tags.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceResourceIds:ControlScope'</a>,
--   <a>controlScope_complianceResourceIds</a> - The ID of the only Amazon
--   Web Services resource that you want your control scope to contain.
newControlScope :: ControlScope

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes one or more types of
--   resources, such as <tt>EFS</tt> or <tt>RDS</tt>.
controlScope_complianceResourceTypes :: Lens' ControlScope (Maybe [Text])

-- | Describes whether the control scope includes resources with one or
--   more tags. Each tag is a key-value pair.
controlScope_tags :: Lens' ControlScope (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The ID of the only Amazon Web Services resource that you want your
--   control scope to contain.
controlScope_complianceResourceIds :: Lens' ControlScope (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The details of the copy operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyAction</a> smart constructor.
data CopyAction
CopyAction' :: Maybe Lifecycle -> Text -> CopyAction
[$sel:lifecycle:CopyAction'] :: CopyAction -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the destination
--   backup vault for the copied backup. For example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:destinationBackupVaultArn:CopyAction'] :: CopyAction -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyAction</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:CopyAction'</a>, <a>copyAction_lifecycle</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationBackupVaultArn:CopyAction'</a>,
--   <a>copyAction_destinationBackupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies the destination backup vault for the
--   copied backup. For example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
newCopyAction :: Text -> CopyAction

-- | Undocumented member.
copyAction_lifecycle :: Lens' CopyAction (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the destination
--   backup vault for the copied backup. For example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
copyAction_destinationBackupVaultArn :: Lens' CopyAction Text

-- | Contains detailed information about a copy job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyJob</a> smart constructor.
data CopyJob
CopyJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CopyJobState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CopyJob

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to copy the target recovery point; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of a copy job.
[$sel:state:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe CopyJobState

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a source recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:sourceRecoveryPointArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
[$sel:resourceType:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a destination
--   copy vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:destinationBackupVaultArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text
[$sel:createdBy:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a destination recovery point; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:destinationRecoveryPointArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID that owns the copy job.
[$sel:accountId:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a source copy
--   vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a copy job.
[$sel:copyJobId:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
[$sel:resourceArn:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to copy a
--   resource.
[$sel:statusMessage:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a copy job.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a copy job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a copy job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:completionDate:CopyJob'] :: CopyJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   identifies a copy job.
--

--   Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
--

--   detailed message explaining the status of the job to copy a resource.

--   date and time a copy job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate
--   to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents
--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_completionDate</a> -
--   The date and time a copy job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
newCopyJob :: CopyJob

--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.

copyJob_destinationRecoveryPointArn :: Lens' CopyJob (Maybe Text)

copyJob_completionDate :: Lens' CopyJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains detailed information about a framework. Frameworks contain
--   controls, which evaluate and report on your backup events and
--   resources. Frameworks generate daily compliance results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFramework</a> smart constructor.
data Framework
Framework' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Framework

-- | The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationTime:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An optional description of the framework with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
[$sel:frameworkDescription:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of controls contained by the framework.
[$sel:numberOfControls:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Int

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:frameworkArn:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | The deployment status of a framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
[$sel:deploymentStatus:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
[$sel:frameworkName:Framework'] :: Framework -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Framework</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkDescription:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_frameworkDescription</a> - An optional description of the
--   framework with a maximum 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfControls:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_numberOfControls</a> - The number of controls contained
--   by the framework.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkArn:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_frameworkArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentStatus:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_deploymentStatus</a> - The deployment status of a
--   framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkName:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_frameworkName</a> -
--   The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
newFramework :: Framework

-- | The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
framework_creationTime :: Lens' Framework (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An optional description of the framework with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
framework_frameworkDescription :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of controls contained by the framework.
framework_numberOfControls :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Int)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
framework_frameworkArn :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment status of a framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
framework_deploymentStatus :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
framework_frameworkName :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains detailed information about all of the controls of a
--   framework. Each framework must contain at least one control.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFrameworkControl</a> smart constructor.
data FrameworkControl
FrameworkControl' :: Maybe ControlScope -> Maybe [ControlInputParameter] -> Text -> FrameworkControl

-- | The scope of a control. The control scope defines what the control
--   will evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans. For
--   more information, see <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
[$sel:controlScope:FrameworkControl'] :: FrameworkControl -> Maybe ControlScope

-- | A list of <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
[$sel:controlInputParameters:FrameworkControl'] :: FrameworkControl -> Maybe [ControlInputParameter]

-- | The name of a control. This name is between 1 and 256 characters.
[$sel:controlName:FrameworkControl'] :: FrameworkControl -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FrameworkControl</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlScope:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlScope</a> - The scope of a control. The
--   control scope defines what the control will evaluate. Three examples
--   of control scopes are: a specific backup plan, all backup plans with a
--   specific tag, or all backup plans. For more information, see
--   <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlInputParameters:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlInputParameters</a> - A list of
--   <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlName:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlName</a> - The name of a control. This name
--   is between 1 and 256 characters.
newFrameworkControl :: Text -> FrameworkControl

-- | The scope of a control. The control scope defines what the control
--   will evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans. For
--   more information, see <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
frameworkControl_controlScope :: Lens' FrameworkControl (Maybe ControlScope)

-- | A list of <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
frameworkControl_controlInputParameters :: Lens' FrameworkControl (Maybe [ControlInputParameter])

-- | The name of a control. This name is between 1 and 256 characters.
frameworkControl_controlName :: Lens' FrameworkControl Text

-- | Contains an array of <tt>Transition</tt> objects specifying how long
--   in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is
--   deleted.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, on the console, the “expire after
--   days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold
--   after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting
--   cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data Lifecycle
Lifecycle' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Lifecycle

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   moved to cold storage.
[$sel:moveToColdStorageAfterDays:Lifecycle'] :: Lifecycle -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
[$sel:deleteAfterDays:Lifecycle'] :: Lifecycle -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Lifecycle</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:moveToColdStorageAfterDays:Lifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycle_moveToColdStorageAfterDays</a> - Specifies the number of
--   days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAfterDays:Lifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycle_deleteAfterDays</a> - Specifies the number of days after
--   creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90
--   days plus <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
newLifecycle :: Lifecycle

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   moved to cold storage.
lifecycle_moveToColdStorageAfterDays :: Lens' Lifecycle (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
lifecycle_deleteAfterDays :: Lens' Lifecycle (Maybe Integer)

-- | A structure that contains information about a backed-up resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectedResource</a> smart constructor.
data ProtectedResource
ProtectedResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ProtectedResource

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:ProtectedResource'] :: ProtectedResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a resource was last backed up, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastBackupTime:ProtectedResource'] :: ProtectedResource -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:ProtectedResource'] :: ProtectedResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtectedResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_resourceType</a> - The type of Amazon Web
--   Services resource; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon
--   EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
--   database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the
--   only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastBackupTime:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_lastBackupTime</a> - The date and time a resource
--   was last backed up, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_resourceArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on
--   the resource type.
newProtectedResource :: ProtectedResource

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
protectedResource_resourceType :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time a resource was last backed up, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
protectedResource_lastBackupTime :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
protectedResource_resourceArn :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains detailed information about the recovery points stored in a
--   backup vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecoveryPointByBackupVault</a> smart constructor.
data RecoveryPointByBackupVault
RecoveryPointByBackupVault' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> RecoveryPointByBackupVault

-- | A Boolean value that is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified
--   recovery point is encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point
--   is not encrypted.
[$sel:isEncrypted:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Bool

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
[$sel:status:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource saved as a recovery point;
--   for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an
--   Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource
--   type is Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery
--   point, including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
[$sel:createdBy:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | A <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
[$sel:calculatedLifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe CalculatedLifecycle

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The backup vault where the recovery point was originally copied from.
--   If the recovery point is restored to the same account this value will
--   be <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format
--   and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:lastRestoreTime:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | A message explaining the reason of the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
[$sel:statusMessage:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionKeyArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a job to restore a recovery point is completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'] :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecoveryPointByBackupVault</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

-- | Contains detailed information about a saved recovery point.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecoveryPointByResource</a> smart constructor.
data RecoveryPointByResource
RecoveryPointByResource' :: Maybe RecoveryPointStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> RecoveryPointByResource

[$sel:status:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus

--   failure.

--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.

--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:RecoveryPointByResource'] :: RecoveryPointByResource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecoveryPointByResource</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RecoveryPointByResource'</a>,

--   state of the recovery point.

--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:RecoveryPointByResource'</a>,

--   the reason of the recovery point deletion failure.

--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,

--   of a backup.

--   <a>$sel:encryptionKeyArn:RecoveryPointByResource'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByResource_encryptionKeyArn</a> - The server-side
--   encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:RecoveryPointByResource'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByResource_creationDate</a> - The date and time a
--   recovery point is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal
--   Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:RecoveryPointByResource'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByResource_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newRecoveryPointByResource :: RecoveryPointByResource

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
recoveryPointByResource_status :: Lens' RecoveryPointByResource (Maybe RecoveryPointStatus)

-- | A message explaining the reason of the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
recoveryPointByResource_statusMessage :: Lens' RecoveryPointByResource (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
recoveryPointByResource_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
recoveryPointByResource_backupSizeBytes :: Lens' RecoveryPointByResource (Maybe Integer)

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
recoveryPointByResource_encryptionKeyArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
recoveryPointByResource_creationDate :: Lens' RecoveryPointByResource (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
recoveryPointByResource_backupVaultName :: Lens' RecoveryPointByResource (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the backup plan and rule that Backup used
--   to initiate the recovery point backup.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecoveryPointCreator</a> smart constructor.
data RecoveryPointCreator
RecoveryPointCreator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RecoveryPointCreator

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanId:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
[$sel:backupPlanArn:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | Version IDs are unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded
--   strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.
[$sel:backupPlanVersion:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule used to schedule the backup of a selection
--   of resources.
[$sel:backupRuleId:RecoveryPointCreator'] :: RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecoveryPointCreator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanId:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanId</a> - Uniquely identifies a
--   backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanArn:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanVersion:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanVersion</a> - Version IDs are
--   unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at
--   most 1,024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupRuleId:RecoveryPointCreator'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointCreator_backupRuleId</a> - Uniquely identifies a rule
--   used to schedule the backup of a selection of resources.
newRecoveryPointCreator :: RecoveryPointCreator

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanId :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)

-- | Version IDs are unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded
--   strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.
recoveryPointCreator_backupPlanVersion :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule used to schedule the backup of a selection
--   of resources.
recoveryPointCreator_backupRuleId :: Lens' RecoveryPointCreator (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information from your report plan about where to deliver your
--   reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and
--   the formats of your reports.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportDeliveryChannel</a> smart constructor.
data ReportDeliveryChannel
ReportDeliveryChannel' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | The prefix for where Backup Audit Manager delivers your reports to
--   Amazon S3. The prefix is this part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
[$sel:s3KeyPrefix:ReportDeliveryChannel'] :: ReportDeliveryChannel -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the format of your reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or
--   both. If not specified, the default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.
[$sel:formats:ReportDeliveryChannel'] :: ReportDeliveryChannel -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The unique name of the S3 bucket that receives your reports.
[$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDeliveryChannel'] :: ReportDeliveryChannel -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportDeliveryChannel</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:ReportDeliveryChannel'</a>,
--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_s3KeyPrefix</a> - The prefix for where Backup
--   Audit Manager delivers your reports to Amazon S3. The prefix is this
--   part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:formats:ReportDeliveryChannel'</a>,
--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_formats</a> - A list of the format of your
--   reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or both. If not specified, the
--   default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDeliveryChannel'</a>,
--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_s3BucketName</a> - The unique name of the S3
--   bucket that receives your reports.
newReportDeliveryChannel :: Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | The prefix for where Backup Audit Manager delivers your reports to
--   Amazon S3. The prefix is this part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
reportDeliveryChannel_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the format of your reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or
--   both. If not specified, the default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.
reportDeliveryChannel_formats :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel (Maybe [Text])

-- | The unique name of the S3 bucket that receives your reports.
reportDeliveryChannel_s3BucketName :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel Text

-- | Contains information from your report job about your report
--   destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportDestination</a> smart constructor.
data ReportDestination
ReportDestination' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> ReportDestination

-- | The object key that uniquely identifies your reports in your S3
--   bucket.
[$sel:s3Keys:ReportDestination'] :: ReportDestination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The unique name of the Amazon S3 bucket that receives your reports.
[$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDestination'] :: ReportDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Keys:ReportDestination'</a>, <a>reportDestination_s3Keys</a>
--   - The object key that uniquely identifies your reports in your S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:ReportDestination'</a>,
--   <a>reportDestination_s3BucketName</a> - The unique name of the Amazon
--   S3 bucket that receives your reports.
newReportDestination :: ReportDestination

-- | The object key that uniquely identifies your reports in your S3
--   bucket.
reportDestination_s3Keys :: Lens' ReportDestination (Maybe [Text])

-- | The unique name of the Amazon S3 bucket that receives your reports.
reportDestination_s3BucketName :: Lens' ReportDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains detailed information about a report job. A report job
--   compiles a report based on a report plan and publishes it to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportJob</a> smart constructor.
data ReportJob
ReportJob' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportDestination -> Maybe Text -> ReportJob

-- | The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationTime:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The status of a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.
[$sel:status:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:completionTime:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated,
--   Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report
--   job IDs cannot be edited.
[$sel:reportJobId:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | A message explaining the status of the report job.
[$sel:statusMessage:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The S3 bucket name and S3 keys for the destination where the report
--   job publishes the report.
[$sel:reportDestination:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe ReportDestination

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
[$sel:reportTemplate:ReportJob'] :: ReportJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_status</a> - The status of
--   a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportPlanArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_completionTime</a>
--   - The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportJobId:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportJobId</a> - The
--   identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated, Unicode,
--   UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report job IDs
--   cannot be edited.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_statusMessage</a> -
--   A message explaining the status of the report job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDestination:ReportJob'</a>,
--   <a>reportJob_reportDestination</a> - The S3 bucket name and S3 keys
--   for the destination where the report job publishes the report.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportTemplate:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportTemplate</a>
--   - Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built
--   using a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
newReportJob :: ReportJob

-- | The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportJob_creationTime :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.
reportJob_status :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
reportJob_reportPlanArn :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportJob_completionTime :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated,
--   Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report
--   job IDs cannot be edited.
reportJob_reportJobId :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A message explaining the status of the report job.
reportJob_statusMessage :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 bucket name and S3 keys for the destination where the report
--   job publishes the report.
reportJob_reportDestination :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe ReportDestination)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
reportJob_reportTemplate :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains detailed information about a report plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportPlan</a> smart constructor.
data ReportPlan
ReportPlan' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportSetting -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel -> ReportPlan

-- | The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationTime:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
[$sel:reportPlanName:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
[$sel:reportSetting:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe ReportSetting

-- | An optional description of the report plan with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
[$sel:reportPlanDescription:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan
--   last attempted to run, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastAttemptedExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastAttemptedExecutionTime:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The deployment status of a report plan. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED
--   </pre>
[$sel:deploymentStatus:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan
--   last successfully ran, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastSuccessfulExecutionTime</tt> is accurate
--   to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents
--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastSuccessfulExecutionTime:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Contains information about where and how to deliver your reports,
--   specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the
--   formats of your reports.
[$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:ReportPlan'] :: ReportPlan -> Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportPlan</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ReportPlan'</a>, <a>reportPlan_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanName:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportPlanName</a> - The unique name of the report plan.

--   consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportPlan'</a>, <a>reportPlan_reportPlanArn</a>

--   The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanDescription:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportPlanDescription</a> - An optional description of
--   the report plan with a maximum 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAttemptedExecutionTime:ReportPlan'</a>,

--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfulExecutionTime:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_lastSuccessfulExecutionTime</a> - The date and time that
--   a report job associated with this report plan last successfully ran,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastSuccessfulExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel</a> - Contains information about
--   where and how to deliver your reports, specifically your Amazon S3
--   bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the formats of your reports.
newReportPlan :: ReportPlan

-- | The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportPlan_creationTime :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
reportPlan_reportPlanName :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
reportPlan_reportPlanArn :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
reportPlan_reportSetting :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe ReportSetting)

-- | An optional description of the report plan with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
reportPlan_reportPlanDescription :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan
--   last attempted to run, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastAttemptedExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportPlan_lastAttemptedExecutionTime :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The deployment status of a report plan. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED
--   </pre>
reportPlan_deploymentStatus :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan
--   last successfully ran, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastSuccessfulExecutionTime</tt> is accurate
--   to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents
--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportPlan_lastSuccessfulExecutionTime :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains information about where and how to deliver your reports,
--   specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the
--   formats of your reports.
reportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel)

-- | Contains detailed information about a report setting.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportSetting</a> smart constructor.
data ReportSetting
ReportSetting' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ReportSetting

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the frameworks a report covers.
[$sel:frameworkArns:ReportSetting'] :: ReportSetting -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The number of frameworks a report covers.
[$sel:numberOfFrameworks:ReportSetting'] :: ReportSetting -> Maybe Int

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
[$sel:reportTemplate:ReportSetting'] :: ReportSetting -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportSetting</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkArns:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_frameworkArns</a> - The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   of the frameworks a report covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfFrameworks:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_numberOfFrameworks</a> - The number of frameworks a
--   report covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportTemplate:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_reportTemplate</a> - Identifies the report template
--   for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report
--   templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
newReportSetting :: Text -> ReportSetting

-- | The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the frameworks a report covers.
reportSetting_frameworkArns :: Lens' ReportSetting (Maybe [Text])

-- | The number of frameworks a report covers.
reportSetting_numberOfFrameworks :: Lens' ReportSetting (Maybe Int)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
reportSetting_reportTemplate :: Lens' ReportSetting Text

-- | Contains metadata about a restore job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreJobsListMember</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreJobsListMember
RestoreJobsListMember' :: Maybe RestoreJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> RestoreJobsListMember

-- | A status code specifying the state of the job initiated by Backup to
--   restore a recovery point.
[$sel:status:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe RestoreJobStatus

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is
--   expected to take.
[$sel:expectedCompletionTimeMinutes:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.
[$sel:restoreJobId:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource type of the listed restore jobs; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
[$sel:resourceType:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
[$sel:percentDone:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID that owns the restore job.
[$sel:accountId:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:createdResourceArn:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to restore a
--   recovery point.
[$sel:statusMessage:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the restored resource.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time a restore job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time a job to restore a recovery point is completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:RestoreJobsListMember'] :: RestoreJobsListMember -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreJobsListMember</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_status</a> - A status code specifying the
--   state of the job initiated by Backup to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,

--   used to create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedCompletionTimeMinutes:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_expectedCompletionTimeMinutes</a> - The
--   amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is
--   expected to take.
--

--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_restoreJobId</a> - Uniquely identifies the
--   job that restores a recovery point.
--

--   listed restore jobs; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store

--   the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.

--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.

--   of the restored resource.
--

--   restore job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_completionDate</a> - The date and time a job
--   to restore a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
newRestoreJobsListMember :: RestoreJobsListMember

-- | A status code specifying the state of the job initiated by Backup to
--   restore a recovery point.
restoreJobsListMember_status :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe RestoreJobStatus)

-- | Assigns a set of key-value pairs to a recovery point, backup plan, or
--   backup vault identified by an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
module Network.AWS.Backup.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> Sensitive (HashMap Text Text) -> TagResource

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the type of the tagged resource.
[$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | Key-value pairs that are used to help organize your resources. You can
--   assign your own metadata to the resources you create.
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the type of the tagged resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - Key-value
--   pairs that are used to help organize your resources. You can assign
--   your own metadata to the resources you create.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the type of the tagged resource.
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | Key-value pairs that are used to help organize your resources. You can
--   assign your own metadata to the resources you create.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)
