-- | Recovers the saved resource identified by an Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN).
module Network.AWS.Backup.StartRestoreJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartRestoreJob</a> smart constructor.
data StartRestoreJob
StartRestoreJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Sensitive (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> StartRestoreJob

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>StartRestoreJob</tt>. Retrying a
--   successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:StartRestoreJob'] :: StartRestoreJob -> Maybe Text

-- | Starts a job to restore a recovery point for one of the following
--   resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:resourceType:StartRestoreJob'] :: StartRestoreJob -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:StartRestoreJob'] :: StartRestoreJob -> Text

-- | A set of metadata key-value pairs. Contains information, such as a
--   resource name, required to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   You can get configuration metadata about a resource at the time it was
--   backed up by calling <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.
--   However, values in addition to those provided by
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt> might be required to restore
--   a resource. For example, you might need to provide a new resource name
--   if the original already exists.
--   
--   You need to specify specific metadata to restore an Amazon Elastic
--   File System (Amazon EFS) instance:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>file-system-id</tt>: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that
--   is backed up by Backup. Returned in
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Encrypted</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that
--   the file system is encrypted. If <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> is specified,
--   <tt>Encrypted</tt> must be set to <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>KmsKeyId</tt>: Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key that
--   is used to encrypt the restored file system. You can specify a key
--   from another Amazon Web Services account provided that key it is
--   properly shared with your account via Amazon Web Services KMS.</li>
--   <li><tt>PerformanceMode</tt>: Specifies the throughput mode of the
--   file system.</li>
--   <li><tt>CreationToken</tt>: A user-supplied value that ensures the
--   uniqueness (idempotency) of the request.</li>
--   <li><tt>newFileSystem</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies
--   that the recovery point is restored to a new Amazon EFS file
--   system.</li>
--   <li><tt>ItemsToRestore</tt>: An array of one to five strings where
--   each string is a file path. Use <tt>ItemsToRestore</tt> to restore
--   specific files or directories rather than the entire file system. This
--   parameter is optional. For example,
--   <tt>"itemsToRestore":"[\"/my.test\"]"</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:metadata:StartRestoreJob'] :: StartRestoreJob -> Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Backup uses to
--   create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:StartRestoreJob'] :: StartRestoreJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartRestoreJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_idempotencyToken</a> - A customer-chosen string
--   that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to
--   <tt>StartRestoreJob</tt>. Retrying a successful request with the same
--   idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_resourceType</a> - Starts a job to restore a
--   recovery point for one of the following resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_recoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:StartRestoreJob'</a>, <a>startRestoreJob_metadata</a>
--   - A set of metadata key-value pairs. Contains information, such as a
--   resource name, required to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   You can get configuration metadata about a resource at the time it was
--   backed up by calling <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.
--   However, values in addition to those provided by
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt> might be required to restore
--   a resource. For example, you might need to provide a new resource name
--   if the original already exists.
--   
--   You need to specify specific metadata to restore an Amazon Elastic
--   File System (Amazon EFS) instance:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>file-system-id</tt>: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that
--   is backed up by Backup. Returned in
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Encrypted</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that
--   the file system is encrypted. If <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> is specified,
--   <tt>Encrypted</tt> must be set to <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>KmsKeyId</tt>: Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key that
--   is used to encrypt the restored file system. You can specify a key
--   from another Amazon Web Services account provided that key it is
--   properly shared with your account via Amazon Web Services KMS.</li>
--   <li><tt>PerformanceMode</tt>: Specifies the throughput mode of the
--   file system.</li>
--   <li><tt>CreationToken</tt>: A user-supplied value that ensures the
--   uniqueness (idempotency) of the request.</li>
--   <li><tt>newFileSystem</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies
--   that the recovery point is restored to a new Amazon EFS file
--   system.</li>
--   <li><tt>ItemsToRestore</tt>: An array of one to five strings where
--   each string is a file path. Use <tt>ItemsToRestore</tt> to restore
--   specific files or directories rather than the entire file system. This
--   parameter is optional. For example,
--   <tt>"itemsToRestore":"[\"/my.test\"]"</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the IAM role that Backup uses to create the target recovery point; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
newStartRestoreJob :: Text -> Text -> StartRestoreJob

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>StartRestoreJob</tt>. Retrying a
--   successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.
startRestoreJob_idempotencyToken :: Lens' StartRestoreJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Starts a job to restore a recovery point for one of the following
--   resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
startRestoreJob_resourceType :: Lens' StartRestoreJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
startRestoreJob_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' StartRestoreJob Text

-- | A set of metadata key-value pairs. Contains information, such as a
--   resource name, required to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   You can get configuration metadata about a resource at the time it was
--   backed up by calling <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.
--   However, values in addition to those provided by
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt> might be required to restore
--   a resource. For example, you might need to provide a new resource name
--   if the original already exists.
--   
--   You need to specify specific metadata to restore an Amazon Elastic
--   File System (Amazon EFS) instance:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>file-system-id</tt>: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that
--   is backed up by Backup. Returned in
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Encrypted</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that
--   the file system is encrypted. If <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> is specified,
--   <tt>Encrypted</tt> must be set to <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>KmsKeyId</tt>: Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key that
--   is used to encrypt the restored file system. You can specify a key
--   from another Amazon Web Services account provided that key it is
--   properly shared with your account via Amazon Web Services KMS.</li>
--   <li><tt>PerformanceMode</tt>: Specifies the throughput mode of the
--   file system.</li>
--   <li><tt>CreationToken</tt>: A user-supplied value that ensures the
--   uniqueness (idempotency) of the request.</li>
--   <li><tt>newFileSystem</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies
--   that the recovery point is restored to a new Amazon EFS file
--   system.</li>
--   <li><tt>ItemsToRestore</tt>: An array of one to five strings where
--   each string is a file path. Use <tt>ItemsToRestore</tt> to restore
--   specific files or directories rather than the entire file system. This
--   parameter is optional. For example,
--   <tt>"itemsToRestore":"[\"/my.test\"]"</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
startRestoreJob_metadata :: Lens' StartRestoreJob (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Backup uses to
--   create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
startRestoreJob_iamRoleArn :: Lens' StartRestoreJob Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartRestoreJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartRestoreJobResponse
StartRestoreJobResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> StartRestoreJobResponse

-- | Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.
[$sel:restoreJobId:StartRestoreJobResponse'] :: StartRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.

--   
--   Does not support continuous backups.

--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>StartCopyJob</tt>. Retrying a

--   created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

-- | Starts an on-demand backup job for the specified resource.
module Network.AWS.Backup.StartBackupJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartBackupJob</a> smart constructor.
data StartBackupJob
StartBackupJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartBackupJob

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>StartBackupJob</tt>. Retrying a
--   successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Maybe Text

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:recoveryPointTags:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A value in minutes during which a successfully started backup must
--   complete, or else AWS Backup will cancel the job. This value is
--   optional. This value begins counting down from when the backup was
--   scheduled. It does not add additional time for
--   <tt>StartWindowMinutes</tt>, or if the backup started later than
--   scheduled.
[$sel:completeWindowMinutes:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS""disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. The
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
[$sel:backupOptions:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional, and
--   the default is 8 hours.
[$sel:startWindowMinutes:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Text

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:StartBackupJob'] :: StartBackupJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartBackupJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_idempotencyToken</a> - A customer-chosen string that
--   you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to
--   <tt>StartBackupJob</tt>. Retrying a successful request with the same
--   idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:StartBackupJob'</a>, <a>startBackupJob_lifecycle</a>
--   - The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointTags:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_recoveryPointTags</a> - To help organize your
--   resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you
--   create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completeWindowMinutes:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_completeWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes
--   during which a successfully started backup must complete, or else AWS
--   Backup will cancel the job. This value is optional. This value begins
--   counting down from when the backup was scheduled. It does not add
--   additional time for <tt>StartWindowMinutes</tt>, or if the backup
--   started later than scheduled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_backupOptions</a> - Specifies the backup option for
--   a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS""disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. The
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startWindowMinutes:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_startWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start
--   successfully. This value is optional, and the default is 8 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_resourceArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that
--   uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the
--   resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM role ARN used to
--   create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
newStartBackupJob :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StartBackupJob

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>StartBackupJob</tt>. Retrying a
--   successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.
startBackupJob_idempotencyToken :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
startBackupJob_lifecycle :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
startBackupJob_recoveryPointTags :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A value in minutes during which a successfully started backup must
--   complete, or else AWS Backup will cancel the job. This value is
--   optional. This value begins counting down from when the backup was
--   scheduled. It does not add additional time for
--   <tt>StartWindowMinutes</tt>, or if the backup started later than
--   scheduled.
startBackupJob_completeWindowMinutes :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS""disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. The
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
startBackupJob_backupOptions :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional, and
--   the default is 8 hours.
startBackupJob_startWindowMinutes :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
startBackupJob_backupVaultName :: Lens' StartBackupJob Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
startBackupJob_resourceArn :: Lens' StartBackupJob Text

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
startBackupJob_iamRoleArn :: Lens' StartBackupJob Text

-- | Turns on notifications on a backup vault for the specified topic and
--   events.
module Network.AWS.Backup.PutBackupVaultNotifications

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBackupVaultNotifications</a> smart constructor.
data PutBackupVaultNotifications
PutBackupVaultNotifications' :: Text -> Text -> [BackupVaultEvent] -> PutBackupVaultNotifications

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:PutBackupVaultNotifications'] :: PutBackupVaultNotifications -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that specifies the topic for a backup
--   vault’s events; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:111122223333:MyVaultTopic</tt>.
[$sel:sNSTopicArn:PutBackupVaultNotifications'] :: PutBackupVaultNotifications -> Text

-- | An array of events that indicate the status of jobs to back up
--   resources to the backup vault.
--   
--   The following events are supported:
--   
--   <tt>BACKUP_JOB_STARTED</tt>, <tt>BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED</tt>,
--   
--   <tt>COPY_JOB_STARTED</tt>, <tt>COPY_JOB_SUCCESSFUL</tt>,
--   <tt>COPY_JOB_FAILED</tt>,
--   
--   <tt>RESTORE_JOB_STARTED</tt>, <tt>RESTORE_JOB_COMPLETED</tt>, and
--   <tt>RECOVERY_POINT_MODIFIED</tt>.
--   
--   To find failed backup jobs, use <tt>BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED</tt> and
--   filter using event metadata.
--   
--   Other events in the following list are deprecated.
[$sel:backupVaultEvents:PutBackupVaultNotifications'] :: PutBackupVaultNotifications -> [BackupVaultEvent]

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBackupVaultNotifications</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:PutBackupVaultNotifications'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultNotifications_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They
--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sNSTopicArn:PutBackupVaultNotifications'</a>,

--   Name (ARN) that specifies the topic for a backup vault’s events; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:111122223333:MyVaultTopic</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultEvents:PutBackupVaultNotifications'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultNotifications_backupVaultEvents</a> - An array of
--   events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the

--

--   <tt>COPY_JOB_FAILED</tt>,
--   
--   <tt>RESTORE_JOB_STARTED</tt>, <tt>RESTORE_JOB_COMPLETED</tt>, and

--   
--   To find failed backup jobs, use <tt>BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED</tt> and

--

newPutBackupVaultNotifications :: Text -> Text -> PutBackupVaultNotifications

putBackupVaultNotifications_sNSTopicArn :: Lens' PutBackupVaultNotifications Text

-- | Applies Backup Vault Lock to a backup vault, preventing attempts to
--   delete any recovery point stored in or created in a backup vault.
--   Vault Lock also prevents attempts to update the lifecycle policy that
--   controls the retention period of any recovery point currently stored
--   in a backup vault. If specified, Vault Lock enforces a minimum and
--   maximum retention period for future backup and copy jobs that target a
--   backup vault.
module Network.AWS.Backup.PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration
PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the maximum
--   retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This
--   setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies
--   require you to destroy certain data after retaining it for four years
--   (1460 days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not included, Vault Lock does not enforce a
--   maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault. If this
--   parameter is included without a value, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   maximum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault
--   fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:maxRetentionDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'] :: PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration -> Maybe Integer

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the number of days
--   before the lock date. For example, setting <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt>
--   to 30 on Jan. 1, 2022 at 8pm UTC will set the lock date to Jan. 31,
--   2022 at 8pm UTC.
--   
--   Backup enforces a 72-hour cooling-off period before Vault Lock takes
--   effect and becomes immutable. Therefore, you must set
--   <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt> to 3 or greater.
--   
--   Before the lock date, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using
--   <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the Vault Lock
--   configuration using <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt>. On and
--   after the lock date, the Vault Lock becomes immutable and cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, you can delete Vault Lock from the
--   vault using <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the
--   Vault Lock configuration using
--   <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> at any time.
[$sel:changeableForDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'] :: PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration -> Maybe Integer

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the minimum
--   retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This
--   setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies
--   require you to retain certain data for at least seven years (2555
--   days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   minimum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault
--   fails that backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:minRetentionDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'] :: PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration -> Maybe Integer

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the name of the
--   backup vault it protects.
[$sel:backupVaultName:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'] :: PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRetentionDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_maxRetentionDays</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the maximum retention period
--   that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful
--   if, for example, your organization's policies require you to destroy
--   certain data after retaining it for four years (1460 days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not included, Vault Lock does not enforce a
--   maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault. If this
--   parameter is included without a value, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   maximum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault
--   fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeableForDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_changeableForDays</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the number of days before the
--   lock date. For example, setting <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt> to 30 on
--   Jan. 1, 2022 at 8pm UTC will set the lock date to Jan. 31, 2022 at 8pm
--   UTC.
--   
--   Backup enforces a 72-hour cooling-off period before Vault Lock takes
--   effect and becomes immutable. Therefore, you must set
--   <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt> to 3 or greater.
--   
--   Before the lock date, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using
--   <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the Vault Lock
--   configuration using <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt>. On and
--   after the lock date, the Vault Lock becomes immutable and cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, you can delete Vault Lock from the
--   vault using <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the
--   Vault Lock configuration using
--   <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> at any time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minRetentionDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_minRetentionDays</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the minimum retention period
--   that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful
--   if, for example, your organization's policies require you to retain
--   certain data for at least seven years (2555 days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   minimum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault
--   fails that backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_backupVaultName</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the name of the backup vault
--   it protects.
newPutBackupVaultLockConfiguration :: Text -> PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the maximum
--   retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This
--   setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies
--   require you to destroy certain data after retaining it for four years
--   (1460 days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not included, Vault Lock does not enforce a
--   maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault. If this
--   parameter is included without a value, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   maximum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault
--   fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_maxRetentionDays :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the number of days
--   before the lock date. For example, setting <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt>
--   to 30 on Jan. 1, 2022 at 8pm UTC will set the lock date to Jan. 31,
--   2022 at 8pm UTC.
--   
--   Backup enforces a 72-hour cooling-off period before Vault Lock takes
--   effect and becomes immutable. Therefore, you must set
--   <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt> to 3 or greater.
--   
--   Before the lock date, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using
--   <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the Vault Lock
--   configuration using <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt>. On and
--   after the lock date, the Vault Lock becomes immutable and cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, you can delete Vault Lock from the
--   vault using <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the
--   Vault Lock configuration using
--   <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> at any time.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_changeableForDays :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the minimum
--   retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This
--   setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies
--   require you to retain certain data for at least seven years (2555
--   days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   minimum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault
--   fails that backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_minRetentionDays :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the name of the
--   backup vault it protects.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_backupVaultName :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse
PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse' :: PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newPutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse :: PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration.PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration.PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration

--   policy document in JSON format.

--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

--   backups.

-- | Returns a list of jobs that Backup initiated to restore a saved
--   resource, including details about the recovery process.

-- | Returns a list of your report plans. For detailed information about a
--   single report plan, use <tt>DescribeReportPlan</tt>.
module Network.AWS.Backup.ListReportPlans

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListReportPlans</a> smart constructor.

--   list.

--   the next set of items in the list.

--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListReportPlans'</a>,

--   1 to 1000. Optional. If unspecified, the query will return 1 MB of
--   data.

--   unspecified, the query will return 1 MB of data.
listReportPlans_maxResults :: Lens' ListReportPlans (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListReportPlansResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListReportPlansResponse
ListReportPlansResponse' :: Maybe [ReportPlan] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListReportPlansResponse

-- | A list of your report plans with detailed information for each plan.
--   This information includes the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), report plan
--   name, description, settings, delivery channel, deployment status,
--   creation time, and last times the report plan attempted to and
--   successfully ran.

--   12:11:30 AM.

-- | Returns detailed information about all the recovery points of the type
--   specified by a resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
--   
--   For Amazon EFS and Amazon EC2, this action only lists recovery points
--   created by Backup.

-- | Returns detailed information about the recovery points stored in a
--   backup vault.
module Network.AWS.Backup.ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault

--   constructor.
data ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault
ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault

-- | Returns only recovery points that match the specified resource Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN).
[$sel:byResourceArn:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'] :: ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only recovery points that were created after the specified
--   timestamp.
[$sel:byCreatedAfter:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'] :: ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Returns only recovery points that were created before the specified
--   timestamp.

--   if a request is made to return <tt>maxResults</tt> number of items,
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> allows you to return more items in your list
--   starting at the location pointed to by the next token.

-- | The maximum number of items to be returned.
[$sel:maxResults:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'] :: ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault -> Maybe Natural

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   Backup vault name might not be available when a supported service
--   creates the backup.
[$sel:backupVaultName:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'] :: ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Returns metadata about your copy jobs.
module Network.AWS.Backup.ListCopyJobs

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListCopyJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListCopyJobs
ListCopyJobs' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CopyJobState -> Maybe Natural -> ListCopyJobs

-- | Returns only copy jobs that match the specified resource Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN).
[$sel:byResourceArn:ListCopyJobs'] :: ListCopyJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only copy jobs that were created after the specified date.
[$sel:byCreatedAfter:ListCopyJobs'] :: ListCopyJobs -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The account ID to list the jobs from. Returns only copy jobs
--   associated with the specified account ID.
[$sel:byAccountId:ListCopyJobs'] :: ListCopyJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only copy jobs that were created before the specified date.
[$sel:byCreatedBefore:ListCopyJobs'] :: ListCopyJobs -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a source backup
--   vault to copy from; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:byDestinationVaultArn:ListCopyJobs'] :: ListCopyJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only backup jobs for the specified resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:byResourceType:ListCopyJobs'] :: ListCopyJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The next item following a partial list of returned items. For example,
--   if a request is made to return maxResults number of items, NextToken
--   allows you to return more items in your list starting at the location
--   pointed to by the next token.

--   (ARNs), plan IDs, creation and deletion dates, version IDs, plan
--   names, and creator request IDs.

-- | Returns a list of existing backup jobs for an authenticated account
--   for the last 30 days. For a longer period of time, consider using
--   these <a>monitoring tools</a>.
module Network.AWS.Backup.ListBackupJobs

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBackupJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListBackupJobs
ListBackupJobs' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupJobState -> Maybe Natural -> ListBackupJobs

-- | Returns only backup jobs that match the specified resource Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN).
[$sel:byResourceArn:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only backup jobs that were created after the specified date.
[$sel:byCreatedAfter:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The account ID to list the jobs from. Returns only backup jobs
--   associated with the specified account ID.
--   
--   If used from an Organizations management account, passing <tt>*</tt>
--   returns all jobs across the organization.
[$sel:byAccountId:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only backup jobs that were created before the specified date.
[$sel:byCreatedBefore:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Returns only backup jobs that will be stored in the specified backup
--   vault. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the
--   account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where
--   they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and
--   hyphens.
[$sel:byBackupVaultName:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only backup jobs for the specified resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:byResourceType:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | The next item following a partial list of returned items. For example,
--   if a request is made to return <tt>maxResults</tt> number of items,
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> allows you to return more items in your list
--   starting at the location pointed to by the next token.
[$sel:nextToken:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns only backup jobs that are in the specified state.
[$sel:byState:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe BackupJobState

-- | The maximum number of items to be returned.
[$sel:maxResults:ListBackupJobs'] :: ListBackupJobs -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBackupJobs</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Returns the Amazon Web Services resource types supported by Backup.

--   constructor.

--   types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>FSX</tt> for Amazon FSx</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Returns a set of metadata key-value pairs that were used to create the
--   backup.
module Network.AWS.Backup.GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata
GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata' :: Text -> Text -> GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata'] :: GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata -> Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.

--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

-- | Returns selection metadata and a document in JSON format that
--   specifies a list of resources that are associated with a backup plan.
module Network.AWS.Backup.GetBackupSelection

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBackupSelection</a> smart constructor.
data GetBackupSelection
GetBackupSelection' :: Text -> Text -> GetBackupSelection

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanId:GetBackupSelection'] :: GetBackupSelection -> Text

-- | Uniquely identifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources
--   to a backup plan.
[$sel:selectionId:GetBackupSelection'] :: GetBackupSelection -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBackupSelection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanId:GetBackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>getBackupSelection_backupPlanId</a> - Uniquely identifies a backup
--   plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectionId:GetBackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>getBackupSelection_selectionId</a> - Uniquely identifies the body
--   of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.
newGetBackupSelection :: Text -> Text -> GetBackupSelection

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
getBackupSelection_backupPlanId :: Lens' GetBackupSelection Text

-- | Uniquely identifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources
--   to a backup plan.
getBackupSelection_selectionId :: Lens' GetBackupSelection Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBackupSelectionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetBackupSelectionResponse
GetBackupSelectionResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe BackupSelection -> Int -> GetBackupSelectionResponse

-- | Uniquely identifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources
--   to a backup plan.
[$sel:selectionId:GetBackupSelectionResponse'] :: GetBackupSelectionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a backup plan.
[$sel:backupPlanId:GetBackupSelectionResponse'] :: GetBackupSelectionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
[$sel:creatorRequestId:GetBackupSelectionResponse'] :: GetBackupSelectionResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time a backup selection is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:GetBackupSelectionResponse'] :: GetBackupSelectionResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a
--   backup plan.
[$sel:backupSelection:GetBackupSelectionResponse'] :: GetBackupSelectionResponse -> Maybe BackupSelection

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetBackupSelectionResponse'] :: GetBackupSelectionResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBackupSelectionResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   most 1,024 bytes long. Version IDs cannot be edited.

--   list is populated only if the advanced option is set for the backup
--   plan.

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
[$sel:backupPlanArn:GetBackupPlanResponse'] :: GetBackupPlanResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The last time a job to back up resources was run with this backup
--   plan. A date and time, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastExecutionDate</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lastExecutionDate:GetBackupPlanResponse'] :: GetBackupPlanResponse -> Maybe POSIX

--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

--   passed to <tt>GetBackupPlanFromJSON.</tt>

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportBackupPlanTemplateResponse</a> with all

-- | Deletes the specified continuous backup recovery point from Backup and
--   releases control of that continuous backup to the source service, such
--   as Amazon RDS. The source service will continue to create and retain
--   continuous backups using the lifecycle that you specified in your
--   original backup plan.
--   
--   Does not support snapshot backup recovery points.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DisassociateRecoveryPoint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisassociateRecoveryPoint</a> smart constructor.
data DisassociateRecoveryPoint
DisassociateRecoveryPoint' :: Text -> Text -> DisassociateRecoveryPoint

-- | The unique name of an Backup vault.
[$sel:backupVaultName:DisassociateRecoveryPoint'] :: DisassociateRecoveryPoint -> Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies an Backup
--   recovery point.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:DisassociateRecoveryPoint'] :: DisassociateRecoveryPoint -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisassociateRecoveryPoint</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:DisassociateRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateRecoveryPoint_backupVaultName</a> - The unique name of
--   an Backup vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:DisassociateRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>disassociateRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn</a> - An Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies an Backup recovery point.
newDisassociateRecoveryPoint :: Text -> Text -> DisassociateRecoveryPoint

-- | The unique name of an Backup vault.
disassociateRecoveryPoint_backupVaultName :: Lens' DisassociateRecoveryPoint Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies an Backup
--   recovery point.
disassociateRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DisassociateRecoveryPoint Text

--   constructor.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

describeRestoreJob_restoreJobId :: Lens' DescribeRestoreJob Text

DescribeRestoreJobResponse' :: Maybe RestoreJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Int -> DescribeRestoreJobResponse

-- | Status code specifying the state of the job that is initiated by
--   Backup to restore a recovery point.
[$sel:status:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe RestoreJobStatus

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is
--   expected to take.
[$sel:expectedCompletionTimeMinutes:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.
[$sel:restoreJobId:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns metadata associated with a restore job listed by resource
--   type.
[$sel:resourceType:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains an estimated percentage that is complete of a job at the time
--   the job status was queried.
[$sel:percentDone:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns the account ID that owns the restore job.
[$sel:accountId:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource
--   whose recovery point is being restored. The format of the ARN depends
--   on the resource type of the backed-up resource.
[$sel:createdResourceArn:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A message showing the status of a job to restore a recovery point.
[$sel:statusMessage:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of the restored resource.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time that a restore job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time that a job to restore a recovery point is completed,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:DescribeRestoreJobResponse'] :: DescribeRestoreJobResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Returns the details associated with creating a report as specified by
--   its <tt>ReportJobId</tt>.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeReportJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeReportJob</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeReportJob
DescribeReportJob' :: Text -> DescribeReportJob

-- | The identifier of the report job. A unique, randomly generated,
--   Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. The
--   report job ID cannot be edited.
[$sel:reportJobId:DescribeReportJob'] :: DescribeReportJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeReportJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportJobId:DescribeReportJob'</a>,
--   <a>describeReportJob_reportJobId</a> - The identifier of the report
--   job. A unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that
--   is at most 1,024 bytes long. The report job ID cannot be edited.
newDescribeReportJob :: Text -> DescribeReportJob

-- | The identifier of the report job. A unique, randomly generated,
--   Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. The
--   report job ID cannot be edited.
describeReportJob_reportJobId :: Lens' DescribeReportJob Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeReportJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeReportJobResponse
DescribeReportJobResponse' :: Maybe ReportJob -> Int -> DescribeReportJobResponse

-- | A list of information about a report job, including its completion and
--   creation times, report destination, unique report job ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), report template, status, and status message.
[$sel:reportJob:DescribeReportJobResponse'] :: DescribeReportJobResponse -> Maybe ReportJob

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeReportJobResponse'] :: DescribeReportJobResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeReportJobResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportJob:DescribeReportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeReportJobResponse_reportJob</a> - A list of information
--   about a report job, including its completion and creation times,
--   report destination, unique report job ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN),
--   report template, status, and status message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeReportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeReportJobResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeReportJobResponse :: Int -> DescribeReportJobResponse

-- | A list of information about a report job, including its completion and
--   creation times, report destination, unique report job ID, Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN), report template, status, and status message.
describeReportJobResponse_reportJob :: Lens' DescribeReportJobResponse (Maybe ReportJob)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeReportJobResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeReportJobResponse Int

-- | Returns the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service
--   opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that
--   service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in
--   an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does
--   not try to protect that service's resources in this Region.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeRegionSettings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeRegionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeRegionSettings
DescribeRegionSettings' :: DescribeRegionSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeRegionSettings</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDescribeRegionSettings :: DescribeRegionSettings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeRegionSettingsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeRegionSettingsResponse
DescribeRegionSettingsResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Bool) -> Int -> DescribeRegionSettingsResponse

-- | Returns a list of all services along with the opt-in preferences in
--   the Region.
[$sel:resourceTypeOptInPreference:DescribeRegionSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeRegionSettingsResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Bool)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeRegionSettingsResponse'] :: DescribeRegionSettingsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeRegionSettingsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTypeOptInPreference:DescribeRegionSettingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRegionSettingsResponse_resourceTypeOptInPreference</a> -
--   Returns a list of all services along with the opt-in preferences in
--   the Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeRegionSettingsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRegionSettingsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeRegionSettingsResponse :: Int -> DescribeRegionSettingsResponse

-- | Returns a list of all services along with the opt-in preferences in
--   the Region.
describeRegionSettingsResponse_resourceTypeOptInPreference :: Lens' DescribeRegionSettingsResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Bool))

-- | The response's http status code.
describeRegionSettingsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeRegionSettingsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeRegionSettings.DescribeRegionSettings
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeRegionSettings.DescribeRegionSettings
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeRegionSettings.DescribeRegionSettings
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeRegionSettings.DescribeRegionSettings

-- | Returns metadata associated with a recovery point, including ID,
--   status, encryption, and lifecycle.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeRecoveryPoint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeRecoveryPoint</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeRecoveryPoint
DescribeRecoveryPoint' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeRecoveryPoint

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeRecoveryPoint'] :: DescribeRecoveryPoint -> Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:DescribeRecoveryPoint'] :: DescribeRecoveryPoint -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeRecoveryPoint</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPoint_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:DescribeRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn</a> - An Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
newDescribeRecoveryPoint :: Text -> Text -> DescribeRecoveryPoint

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
describeRecoveryPoint_backupVaultName :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPoint Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
describeRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPoint Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeRecoveryPointResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeRecoveryPointResponse
DescribeRecoveryPointResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeRecoveryPointResponse

-- | A Boolean value that is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified
--   recovery point is encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point
--   is not encrypted.
[$sel:isEncrypted:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
--   
--   <tt>PARTIAL</tt> status indicates Backup could not create the recovery
--   point before the backup window closed. To increase your backup plan
--   window using the API, see <a>UpdateBackupPlan</a>. You can also
--   increase your backup plan window using the Console by choosing and
--   editing your backup plan.
--   
--   <tt>EXPIRED</tt> status indicates that the recovery point has exceeded
--   its retention period, but Backup lacks permission or is otherwise
--   unable to delete it. To manually delete these recovery points, see
--   <a>Step 3: Delete the recovery points</a> in the <i>Clean up
--   resources</i> section of <i>Getting started</i>.
[$sel:status:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to save as a recovery point;
--   for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an
--   Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
[$sel:resourceType:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery
--   point, including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
[$sel:createdBy:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | A <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
[$sel:calculatedLifecycle:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe CalculatedLifecycle

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups that are transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold
--   storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days”
--   setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after
--   days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be
--   changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
[$sel:lifecycle:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the source
--   vault where the resource was originally backed up in; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:BackupVault</tt>. If
--   the recovery is restored to the same Amazon Web Services account or
--   Region, this value will be <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a recovery point was last restored, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:lastRestoreTime:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the
--   ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A status message explaining the reason for the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
[$sel:statusMessage:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are
--   <tt>WARM</tt> or <tt>COLD</tt>.
[$sel:storageClass:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption key used to protect your backups; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionKeyArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time that a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time that a job to create a recovery point is completed,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'] :: DescribeRecoveryPointResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeRecoveryPointResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

describeRecoveryPointResponse_resourceArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A status message explaining the reason for the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_statusMessage :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are
--   <tt>WARM</tt> or <tt>COLD</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_storageClass :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption key used to protect your backups; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_encryptionKeyArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_backupSizeInBytes :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time that a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_creationDate :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time that a job to create a recovery point is completed,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_completionDate :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_backupVaultName :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeRecoveryPoint.DescribeRecoveryPoint

-- | Returns the framework details for the specified
--   <tt>FrameworkName</tt>.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeFramework

data DescribeFramework
DescribeFramework' :: Text -> DescribeFramework

-- | The unique name of a framework.

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeFramework</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>describeFramework_frameworkName</a> - The unique name of a
--   framework.
newDescribeFramework :: Text -> DescribeFramework
