describeFramework_frameworkName :: Lens' DescribeFramework Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeFrameworkResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeFrameworkResponse
DescribeFrameworkResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [FrameworkControl] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> DescribeFrameworkResponse

-- | The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationTime:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>DescribeFrameworkOutput</tt>.
--   Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results
--   in a success message with no action taken.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional description of the framework.
[$sel:frameworkDescription:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control governs a
--   resource, such as backup plans, backup selections, backup vaults, or
--   recovery points. You can also turn Config recording on or off for each
--   resource. The statuses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned on for all resources
--   governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARTIALLY_ACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned off for at
--   least one resource governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>INACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned off for all resources
--   governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> when Backup is unable to validate recording
--   status at this time.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:frameworkStatus:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the controls that make up the framework. Each control in the
--   list has a name, input parameters, and scope.
[$sel:frameworkControls:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe [FrameworkControl]

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:frameworkArn:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The deployment status of a framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
[$sel:deploymentStatus:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of a framework.
[$sel:frameworkName:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeFrameworkResponse'] :: DescribeFrameworkResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeFrameworkResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

-- | Returns metadata about a backup vault specified by its name.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeBackupVault

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackupVault</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackupVault
DescribeBackupVault' :: Text -> DescribeBackupVault

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeBackupVault'] :: DescribeBackupVault -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackupVault</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVault_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newDescribeBackupVault :: Text -> DescribeBackupVault

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
describeBackupVault_backupVaultName :: Lens' DescribeBackupVault Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackupVaultResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackupVaultResponse
DescribeBackupVaultResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Int -> DescribeBackupVaultResponse

-- | The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change any of your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault
--   Lock from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:lockDate:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention
--   period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite
--   storage).
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the
--   maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than
--   that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy
--   job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a
--   different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to
--   Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:maxRetentionDays:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | A Boolean that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock is currently
--   protecting the backup vault. <tt>True</tt> means that Vault Lock
--   causes delete or update operations on the recovery points stored in
--   the vault to fail.
[$sel:locked:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
[$sel:creatorRequestId:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.
[$sel:numberOfRecoveryPoints:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionKeyArn:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that a backup vault is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention
--   period.
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the
--   minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter
--   than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or
--   copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use
--   a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior
--   to Vault Lock are not affected.
[$sel:minRetentionDays:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'] :: DescribeBackupVaultResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | Returns backup job details for the specified <tt>BackupJobId</tt>.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeBackupJob

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackupJob</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackupJob
DescribeBackupJob' :: Text -> DescribeBackupJob

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
[$sel:backupJobId:DescribeBackupJob'] :: DescribeBackupJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackupJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupJobId:DescribeBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJob_backupJobId</a> - Uniquely identifies a request
--   to Backup to back up a resource.
newDescribeBackupJob :: Text -> DescribeBackupJob

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
describeBackupJob_backupJobId :: Lens' DescribeBackupJob Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackupJobResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackupJobResponse
DescribeBackupJobResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupJobState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Int -> DescribeBackupJobResponse

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of a resource recovery point.
[$sel:state:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe BackupJobState

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
[$sel:resourceType:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains an estimated percentage that is complete of a job at the time
--   the job status was queried.
[$sel:percentDone:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:startBy:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
[$sel:createdBy:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator

-- | The date and time that a job to back up resources is expected to be
--   completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The
--   value of <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:expectedCompletionDate:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the
--   job status was queried.
[$sel:bytesTransferred:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
[$sel:backupVaultArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns the account ID that owns the backup job.
[$sel:accountId:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
[$sel:backupJobId:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the
--   ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:resourceArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a
--   resource.
[$sel:statusMessage:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
[$sel:backupSizeInBytes:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The date and time that a backup job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date and time that a job to create a backup job is completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
[$sel:completionDate:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Represents the actual backup type selected for a backup job. For
--   example, if a successful Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS)
--   backup was taken, <tt>BackupType</tt> returns <tt>"WindowsVSS"</tt>.
--   If <tt>BackupType</tt> is empty, then the backup type was a regular
--   backup.
[$sel:backupType:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Represents the options specified as part of backup plan or on-demand
--   backup job.
[$sel:backupOptions:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeBackupJobResponse'] :: DescribeBackupJobResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackupJobResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM role
--   ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_state</a> - The current state of a
--   resource recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_resourceType</a> - The type of Amazon Web
--   Services resource to be backed up; for example, an Amazon Elastic
--   Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database
--   Service (Amazon RDS) database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentDone:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_percentDone</a> - Contains an estimated
--   percentage that is complete of a job at the time the job status was
--   queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startBy:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_startBy</a> - Specifies the time in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be
--   started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the
--   start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00
--   PM and the start window is 2 hours, the <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be
--   8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_createdBy</a> - Contains identifying
--   information about the creation of a backup job, including the
--   <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedCompletionDate:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_expectedCompletionDate</a> - The date and
--   time that a job to back up resources is expected to be completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesTransferred:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_bytesTransferred</a> - The size in bytes
--   transferred to a backup vault at the time that the job status was
--   queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_backupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_accountId</a> - Returns the account ID
--   that owns the backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupJobId:DescribeBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_backupJobId</a> - Uniquely identifies a
--   request to Backup to back up a resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_resourceArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a saved resource. The format of the ARN depends on the
--   resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_statusMessage</a> - A detailed message
--   explaining the status of the job to back up a resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_recoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that
--   uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in
--   bytes, of a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time that
--   a backup job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_completionDate</a> - The date and time
--   that a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They
--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupType:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_backupType</a> - Represents the actual
--   backup type selected for a backup job. For example, if a successful
--   Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup was taken,
--   <tt>BackupType</tt> returns <tt>"WindowsVSS"</tt>. If
--   <tt>BackupType</tt> is empty, then the backup type was a regular
--   backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_backupOptions</a> - Represents the
--   options specified as part of backup plan or on-demand backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeBackupJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeBackupJobResponse :: Int -> DescribeBackupJobResponse

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
describeBackupJobResponse_iamRoleArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of a resource recovery point.
describeBackupJobResponse_state :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe BackupJobState)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
describeBackupJobResponse_resourceType :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains an estimated percentage that is complete of a job at the time
--   the job status was queried.
describeBackupJobResponse_percentDone :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
describeBackupJobResponse_startBy :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
describeBackupJobResponse_createdBy :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe RecoveryPointCreator)

-- | The date and time that a job to back up resources is expected to be
--   completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The
--   value of <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
describeBackupJobResponse_expectedCompletionDate :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the
--   job status was queried.
describeBackupJobResponse_bytesTransferred :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupVaultArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns the account ID that owns the backup job.
describeBackupJobResponse_accountId :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupJobId :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the
--   ARN depends on the resource type.
describeBackupJobResponse_resourceArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a
--   resource.
describeBackupJobResponse_statusMessage :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
describeBackupJobResponse_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupSizeInBytes :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time that a backup job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
describeBackupJobResponse_creationDate :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time that a job to create a backup job is completed, in
--   Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
describeBackupJobResponse_completionDate :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupVaultName :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the actual backup type selected for a backup job. For
--   example, if a successful Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS)
--   backup was taken, <tt>BackupType</tt> returns <tt>"WindowsVSS"</tt>.
--   If <tt>BackupType</tt> is empty, then the backup type was a regular
--   backup.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupType :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the options specified as part of backup plan or on-demand
--   backup job.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupOptions :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
describeBackupJobResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeBackupJob.DescribeBackupJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Backup.DescribeBackupJob.DescribeBackupJob

-- | Deletes the recovery point specified by a recovery point ID.
--   
--   If the recovery point ID belongs to a continuous backup, calling this
--   endpoint deletes the existing continuous backup and stops future
--   continuous backup.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DeleteRecoveryPoint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteRecoveryPoint</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteRecoveryPoint
DeleteRecoveryPoint' :: Text -> Text -> DeleteRecoveryPoint

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:DeleteRecoveryPoint'] :: DeleteRecoveryPoint -> Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:DeleteRecoveryPoint'] :: DeleteRecoveryPoint -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteRecoveryPoint</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:DeleteRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>deleteRecoveryPoint_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:DeleteRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>deleteRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
newDeleteRecoveryPoint :: Text -> Text -> DeleteRecoveryPoint

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
deleteRecoveryPoint_backupVaultName :: Lens' DeleteRecoveryPoint Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
deleteRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DeleteRecoveryPoint Text

-- | Deletes a backup plan. A backup plan can only be deleted after all
--   associated selections of resources have been deleted. Deleting a
--   backup plan deletes the current version of a backup plan. Previous
--   versions, if any, will still exist.
module Network.AWS.Backup.DeleteBackupPlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBackupPlan</a> smart constructor.

-- | Creates a report plan. A report plan is a document that contains
--   information about the contents of the report and where Backup will
--   deliver it.
--   
--   If you call <tt>CreateReportPlan</tt> with a plan that already exists,
--   you receive an <tt>AlreadyExistsException</tt> exception.
module Network.AWS.Backup.CreateReportPlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateReportPlan</a> smart constructor.
data CreateReportPlan
CreateReportPlan' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel -> ReportSetting -> CreateReportPlan

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>CreateReportPlanInput</tt>. Retrying
--   a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateReportPlan'] :: CreateReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | Metadata that you can assign to help organize the report plans that
--   you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
[$sel:reportPlanTags:CreateReportPlan'] :: CreateReportPlan -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | An optional description of the report plan with a maximum of 1,024
--   characters.
[$sel:reportPlanDescription:CreateReportPlan'] :: CreateReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of the report plan. The name must be between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
[$sel:reportPlanName:CreateReportPlan'] :: CreateReportPlan -> Text

-- | A structure that contains information about where and how to deliver
--   your reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix,
--   and the formats of your reports.
[$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:CreateReportPlan'] :: CreateReportPlan -> ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
[$sel:reportSetting:CreateReportPlan'] :: CreateReportPlan -> ReportSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateReportPlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_idempotencyToken</a> - A customer-chosen string
--   that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to
--   <tt>CreateReportPlanInput</tt>. Retrying a successful request with the
--   same idempotency token results in a success message with no action
--   taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanTags:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_reportPlanTags</a> - Metadata that you can assign
--   to help organize the report plans that you create. Each tag is a
--   key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanDescription:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_reportPlanDescription</a> - An optional
--   description of the report plan with a maximum of 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanName:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_reportPlanName</a> - The unique name of the report
--   plan. The name must be between 1 and 256 characters, starting with a
--   letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and
--   underscores (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel</a> - A structure that
--   contains information about where and how to deliver your reports,
--   specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the
--   formats of your reports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportSetting:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_reportSetting</a> - Identifies the report template
--   for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report
--   templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
newCreateReportPlan :: Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel -> ReportSetting -> CreateReportPlan

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>CreateReportPlanInput</tt>. Retrying
--   a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.

--   you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

--   characters.

-- | The unique name of the report plan. The name must be between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
createReportPlan_reportPlanName :: Lens' CreateReportPlan Text

-- | A structure that contains information about where and how to deliver
--   your reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix,
--   and the formats of your reports.
createReportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel :: Lens' CreateReportPlan ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
createReportPlan_reportSetting :: Lens' CreateReportPlan ReportSetting

-- | Creates a framework with one or more controls. A framework is a
--   collection of controls that you can use to evaluate your backup
--   practices. By using pre-built customizable controls to define your
--   policies, you can evaluate whether your backup practices comply with
--   your policies and which resources are not yet in compliance.
module Network.AWS.Backup.CreateFramework

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateFramework</a> smart constructor.

-- | Creates a logical container where backups are stored. A
--   <tt>CreateBackupVault</tt> request includes a name, optionally one or
--   more resource tags, an encryption key, and a request ID.
--   
--   Do not include sensitive data, such as passport numbers, in the name
--   of a backup vault.
module Network.AWS.Backup.CreateBackupVault

--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of letters, numbers, and hyphens.

-- | Creates a JSON document that specifies a set of resources to assign to
--   a backup plan. Resources can be included by specifying patterns for a
--   <tt>ListOfTags</tt> and selected <tt>Resources</tt>.
--   
--   For example, consider the following patterns:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>Resources:
--   "arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:volume/volume-id"</pre></li>
--   
--   <li><pre>ConditionKey:"department"</pre><pre>ConditionValue:"finance"</pre><pre>ConditionType:"StringEquals"</pre></li>
--   
--   <li><pre>ConditionKey:"importance"</pre><pre>ConditionValue:"critical"</pre><pre>ConditionType:"StringEquals"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Using these patterns would back up all Amazon Elastic Block Store
--   (Amazon EBS) volumes that are tagged as <tt>"department=finance"</tt>,
--   <tt>"importance=critical"</tt>, in addition to an EBS volume with the
--   specified volume ID.
--   
--   Resources and conditions are additive in that all resources that match
--   the pattern are selected. This shouldn't be confused with a logical
--   AND, where all conditions must match. The matching patterns are
--   logically put together using the OR operator. In other words, all
--   patterns that match are selected for backup.
module Network.AWS.Backup.CreateBackupSelection

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackupSelection</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBackupSelection
CreateBackupSelection' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> BackupSelection -> CreateBackupSelection

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
[$sel:creatorRequestId:CreateBackupSelection'] :: CreateBackupSelection -> Maybe Text

-- | Uniquely identifies the backup plan to be associated with the
--   selection of resources.
[$sel:backupPlanId:CreateBackupSelection'] :: CreateBackupSelection -> Text

-- | Specifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a
--   backup plan.
[$sel:backupSelection:CreateBackupSelection'] :: CreateBackupSelection -> BackupSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackupSelection</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creatorRequestId:CreateBackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>createBackupSelection_creatorRequestId</a> - A unique string that
--   identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried
--   without the risk of running the operation twice.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanId:CreateBackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>createBackupSelection_backupPlanId</a> - Uniquely identifies the
--   backup plan to be associated with the selection of resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSelection:CreateBackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>createBackupSelection_backupSelection</a> - Specifies the body of a
--   request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.
newCreateBackupSelection :: Text -> BackupSelection -> CreateBackupSelection

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
createBackupSelection_creatorRequestId :: Lens' CreateBackupSelection (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniquely identifies the backup plan to be associated with the
--   selection of resources.
createBackupSelection_backupPlanId :: Lens' CreateBackupSelection Text

-- | Specifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a
--   backup plan.
createBackupSelection_backupSelection :: Lens' CreateBackupSelection BackupSelection

-- | Creates a backup plan using a backup plan name and backup rules. A
--   backup plan is a document that contains information that Backup uses
--   to schedule tasks that create recovery points for resources.
--   
--   If you call <tt>CreateBackupPlan</tt> with a plan that already exists,
--   you receive an <tt>AlreadyExistsException</tt> exception.
module Network.AWS.Backup.CreateBackupPlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBackupPlan</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBackupPlan
CreateBackupPlan' :: Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Text -> BackupPlanInput -> CreateBackupPlan

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair. The
--   specified tags are assigned to all backups created with this plan.
[$sel:backupPlanTags:CreateBackupPlan'] :: CreateBackupPlan -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried
--   without the risk of running the operation twice. If the request
--   includes a <tt>CreatorRequestId</tt> that matches an existing backup
--   plan, that plan is returned. This parameter is optional.
[$sel:creatorRequestId:CreateBackupPlan'] :: CreateBackupPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a
--   <tt>BackupPlanName</tt> and one or more sets of <tt>Rules</tt>.
[$sel:backupPlan:CreateBackupPlan'] :: CreateBackupPlan -> BackupPlanInput

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBackupPlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanTags:CreateBackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createBackupPlan_backupPlanTags</a> - To help organize your
--   resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you
--   create. Each tag is a key-value pair. The specified tags are assigned
--   to all backups created with this plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creatorRequestId:CreateBackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createBackupPlan_creatorRequestId</a> - Identifies the request and
--   allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of running the
--   operation twice. If the request includes a <tt>CreatorRequestId</tt>
--   that matches an existing backup plan, that plan is returned. This
--   parameter is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlan:CreateBackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createBackupPlan_backupPlan</a> - Specifies the body of a backup
--   plan. Includes a <tt>BackupPlanName</tt> and one or more sets of
--   <tt>Rules</tt>.
newCreateBackupPlan :: BackupPlanInput -> CreateBackupPlan

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair. The
--   specified tags are assigned to all backups created with this plan.
createBackupPlan_backupPlanTags :: Lens' CreateBackupPlan (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried
--   without the risk of running the operation twice. If the request
--   includes a <tt>CreatorRequestId</tt> that matches an existing backup
--   plan, that plan is returned. This parameter is optional.
createBackupPlan_creatorRequestId :: Lens' CreateBackupPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a
--   <tt>BackupPlanName</tt> and one or more sets of <tt>Rules</tt>.
createBackupPlan_backupPlan :: Lens' CreateBackupPlan BackupPlanInput

-- | Updates an existing framework identified by its <tt>FrameworkName</tt>
--   with the input document in JSON format.
module Network.AWS.Backup.UpdateFramework

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateFramework</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateFramework
UpdateFramework' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [FrameworkControl] -> Text -> UpdateFramework

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>UpdateFrameworkInput</tt>. Retrying a
--   successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:UpdateFramework'] :: UpdateFramework -> Maybe Text

-- | An optional description of the framework with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
[$sel:frameworkDescription:UpdateFramework'] :: UpdateFramework -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the controls that make up the framework. Each control in the
--   list has a name, input parameters, and scope.
[$sel:frameworkControls:UpdateFramework'] :: UpdateFramework -> Maybe [FrameworkControl]

-- | The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
[$sel:frameworkName:UpdateFramework'] :: UpdateFramework -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateFramework</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   same idempotency token results in a success message with no action
--   taken.

-- | Updates whether the Amazon Web Services account is opted in to
--   cross-account backup. Returns an error if the account is not an
--   Organizations management account. Use the
--   <tt>DescribeGlobalSettings</tt> API to determine the current settings.

-- | Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
--   
--   The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   Does not support continuous backups.
module Network.AWS.Backup.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle
UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle' :: Maybe Lifecycle -> Text -> Text -> UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
[$sel:lifecycle:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'] :: UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle -> Maybe Lifecycle

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
[$sel:backupVaultName:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'] :: UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle -> Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
[$sel:recoveryPointArn:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'] :: UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_lifecycle</a> - The lifecycle defines
--   when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it
--   expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically
--   according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They
--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_recoveryPointArn</a> - An Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
newUpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle :: Text -> Text -> UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_lifecycle :: Lens' UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_backupVaultName :: Lens' UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle Text

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle Text

-- | Updates the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If
--   service-opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that
--   service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in
--   an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does
--   not try to protect that service's resources in this Region. Use the
--   <tt>DescribeRegionSettings</tt> API to determine the resource types
--   that are supported.
module Network.AWS.Backup.UpdateRegionSettings

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRegionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRegionSettings
UpdateRegionSettings' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Bool) -> UpdateRegionSettings

-- | Updates the list of services along with the opt-in preferences for the
--   Region.
[$sel:resourceTypeOptInPreference:UpdateRegionSettings'] :: UpdateRegionSettings -> Maybe (HashMap Text Bool)

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRegionSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceTypeOptInPreference:UpdateRegionSettings'</a>,
--   <a>updateRegionSettings_resourceTypeOptInPreference</a> - Updates the
--   list of services along with the opt-in preferences for the Region.
newUpdateRegionSettings :: UpdateRegionSettings

-- | Updates the list of services along with the opt-in preferences for the
--   Region.
updateRegionSettings_resourceTypeOptInPreference :: Lens' UpdateRegionSettings (Maybe (HashMap Text Bool))

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRegionSettingsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRegionSettingsResponse
UpdateRegionSettingsResponse' :: UpdateRegionSettingsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRegionSettingsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateRegionSettingsResponse :: UpdateRegionSettingsResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Backup.UpdateRegionSettings.UpdateRegionSettings
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Backup.UpdateRegionSettings.UpdateRegionSettings


-- | Updates an existing report plan identified by its
--   <tt>ReportPlanName</tt> with the input document in JSON format.
module Network.AWS.Backup.UpdateReportPlan

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateReportPlan</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateReportPlan
UpdateReportPlan' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportSetting -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel -> Text -> UpdateReportPlan

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>UpdateReportPlanInput</tt>. Retrying
--   a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a
--   success message with no action taken.
[$sel:idempotencyToken:UpdateReportPlan'] :: UpdateReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
[$sel:reportSetting:UpdateReportPlan'] :: UpdateReportPlan -> Maybe ReportSetting

-- | An optional description of the report plan with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
[$sel:reportPlanDescription:UpdateReportPlan'] :: UpdateReportPlan -> Maybe Text

-- | A structure that contains information about where to deliver your
--   reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and
--   the formats of your reports.
[$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:UpdateReportPlan'] :: UpdateReportPlan -> Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
[$sel:reportPlanName:UpdateReportPlan'] :: UpdateReportPlan -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateReportPlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:UpdateReportPlan'</a>,

--   same idempotency token results in a success message with no action
--   taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportSetting:UpdateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateReportPlan_reportSetting</a> - Identifies the report template

--   templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.

--   <a>$sel:reportPlanDescription:UpdateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateReportPlan_reportPlanDescription</a> - An optional
--   description of the report plan with a maximum 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:UpdateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateReportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel</a> - A structure that
--   contains information about where to deliver your reports, specifically
--   your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the formats of your
--   reports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanName:UpdateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateReportPlan_reportPlanName</a> - The unique name of the report
--   plan. This name is between 1 and 256 characters, starting with a
--   letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and
--   underscores (_).
newUpdateReportPlan :: Text -> UpdateReportPlan

-- | A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between
--   otherwise identical calls to <tt>UpdateReportPlanInput</tt>. Retrying
--   a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a

data UpdateReportPlanResponse
UpdateReportPlanResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> UpdateReportPlanResponse

-- | The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
[$sel:reportPlanArn:UpdateReportPlanResponse'] :: UpdateReportPlanResponse -> Maybe Text

describeBackupJob_backupJobId :: Lens' DescribeBackupJob Text

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
describeBackupJobResponse_iamRoleArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of a resource recovery point.
describeBackupJobResponse_state :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe BackupJobState)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
describeBackupJobResponse_resourceType :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains an estimated percentage that is complete of a job at the time
--   the job status was queried.
describeBackupJobResponse_percentDone :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
describeBackupJobResponse_startBy :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
describeBackupJobResponse_createdBy :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe RecoveryPointCreator)

-- | The date and time that a job to back up resources is expected to be
--   completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The
--   value of <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
describeBackupJobResponse_expectedCompletionDate :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the
--   job status was queried.
describeBackupJobResponse_bytesTransferred :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Integer)

--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupVaultArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns the account ID that owns the backup job.
describeBackupJobResponse_accountId :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
describeBackupJobResponse_backupJobId :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

--   ARN depends on the resource type.
describeBackupJobResponse_resourceArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

--   resource.
describeBackupJobResponse_statusMessage :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

describeBackupJobResponse_backupVaultName :: Lens' DescribeBackupJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the actual backup type selected for a backup job. For
--   example, if a successful Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS)
--   backup was taken, <tt>BackupType</tt> returns <tt>"WindowsVSS"</tt>.
--   If <tt>BackupType</tt> is empty, then the backup type was a regular

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
describeRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPoint Text

-- | A Boolean value that is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified
--   recovery point is encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point
--   is not encrypted.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_isEncrypted :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
--   
--   <tt>PARTIAL</tt> status indicates Backup could not create the recovery
--   point before the backup window closed. To increase your backup plan
--   window using the API, see <a>UpdateBackupPlan</a>. You can also
--   increase your backup plan window using the Console by choosing and
--   editing your backup plan.
--   
--   <tt>EXPIRED</tt> status indicates that the recovery point has exceeded
--   its retention period, but Backup lacks permission or is otherwise
--   unable to delete it. To manually delete these recovery points, see
--   <a>Step 3: Delete the recovery points</a> in the <i>Clean up
--   resources</i> section of <i>Getting started</i>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_status :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe RecoveryPointStatus)

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_iamRoleArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to save as a recovery point;
--   for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an
--   Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_resourceType :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery
--   point, including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_createdBy :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe RecoveryPointCreator)

-- | A <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_calculatedLifecycle :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe CalculatedLifecycle)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups that are transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold
--   storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days”
--   setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after
--   days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be
--   changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_lifecycle :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_backupVaultArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the source
--   vault where the resource was originally backed up in; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:BackupVault</tt>. If
--   the recovery is restored to the same Amazon Web Services account or
--   Region, this value will be <tt>null</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_sourceBackupVaultArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a recovery point was last restored, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_lastRestoreTime :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the
--   ARN depends on the resource type.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_resourceArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A status message explaining the reason for the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_statusMessage :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are
--   <tt>WARM</tt> or <tt>COLD</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_storageClass :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
describeRecoveryPointResponse_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DescribeRecoveryPointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption key used to protect your backups; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.

--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.

--   success message with no action taken.
startBackupJob_idempotencyToken :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
startBackupJob_lifecycle :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to
--   the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
startBackupJob_recoveryPointTags :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A value in minutes during which a successfully started backup must
--   complete, or else AWS Backup will cancel the job. This value is
--   optional. This value begins counting down from when the backup was
--   scheduled. It does not add additional time for
--   <tt>StartWindowMinutes</tt>, or if the backup started later than
--   scheduled.
startBackupJob_completeWindowMinutes :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS""disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. The
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
startBackupJob_backupOptions :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional, and
--   the default is 8 hours.
startBackupJob_startWindowMinutes :: Lens' StartBackupJob (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to

--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
startBackupJob_backupVaultName :: Lens' StartBackupJob Text

describeFrameworkResponse_idempotencyToken :: Lens' DescribeFrameworkResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An optional description of the framework.
describeFrameworkResponse_frameworkDescription :: Lens' DescribeFrameworkResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control governs a
--   resource, such as backup plans, backup selections, backup vaults, or
--   recovery points. You can also turn Config recording on or off for each
--   resource. The statuses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned on for all resources
--   governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARTIALLY_ACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned off for at
--   least one resource governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>INACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned off for all resources
--   governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> when Backup is unable to validate recording
--   status at this time.</li>
--   </ul>
describeFrameworkResponse_frameworkStatus :: Lens' DescribeFrameworkResponse (Maybe Text)

--   list has a name, input parameters, and scope.

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
describeFrameworkResponse_frameworkArn :: Lens' DescribeFrameworkResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change any of your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault
--   Lock from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
describeBackupVaultResponse_lockDate :: Lens' DescribeBackupVaultResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention
--   period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite
--   storage).
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the
--   maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than
--   that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy
--   job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a
--   different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to
--   Vault Lock are not affected.
describeBackupVaultResponse_maxRetentionDays :: Lens' DescribeBackupVaultResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | A Boolean that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock is currently
--   protecting the backup vault. <tt>True</tt> means that Vault Lock
--   causes delete or update operations on the recovery points stored in
--   the vault to fail.
describeBackupVaultResponse_locked :: Lens' DescribeBackupVaultResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
describeBackupVaultResponse_creatorRequestId :: Lens' DescribeBackupVaultResponse (Maybe Text)

describeBackupVaultResponse_backupVaultArn :: Lens' DescribeBackupVaultResponse (Maybe Text)

--   period.

--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a

-- | Starts a job to restore a recovery point for one of the following
--   resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
startRestoreJob_resourceType :: Lens' StartRestoreJob (Maybe Text)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
startRestoreJob_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' StartRestoreJob Text

-- | A set of metadata key-value pairs. Contains information, such as a
--   resource name, required to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   You can get configuration metadata about a resource at the time it was
--   backed up by calling <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.
--   However, values in addition to those provided by
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt> might be required to restore
--   a resource. For example, you might need to provide a new resource name
--   if the original already exists.
--   
--   You need to specify specific metadata to restore an Amazon Elastic
--   File System (Amazon EFS) instance:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>file-system-id</tt>: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that
--   is backed up by Backup. Returned in
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Encrypted</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that
--   the file system is encrypted. If <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> is specified,
--   <tt>Encrypted</tt> must be set to <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>KmsKeyId</tt>: Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key that
--   is used to encrypt the restored file system. You can specify a key
--   from another Amazon Web Services account provided that key it is
--   properly shared with your account via Amazon Web Services KMS.</li>
--   <li><tt>PerformanceMode</tt>: Specifies the throughput mode of the
--   file system.</li>
--   <li><tt>CreationToken</tt>: A user-supplied value that ensures the
--   uniqueness (idempotency) of the request.</li>
--   <li><tt>newFileSystem</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies
--   that the recovery point is restored to a new Amazon EFS file
--   system.</li>
--   <li><tt>ItemsToRestore</tt>: An array of one to five strings where
--   each string is a file path. Use <tt>ItemsToRestore</tt> to restore
--   specific files or directories rather than the entire file system. This
--   parameter is optional. For example,
--   <tt>"itemsToRestore":"[\"/my.test\"]"</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
startRestoreJob_metadata :: Lens' StartRestoreJob (HashMap Text Text)

--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
