-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_lifecycle :: Lens' UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
deleteRecoveryPoint_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' DeleteRecoveryPoint Text

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the maximum
--   retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This
--   setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies
--   require you to destroy certain data after retaining it for four years
--   (1460 days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not included, Vault Lock does not enforce a
--   maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault. If this
--   parameter is included without a value, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   maximum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault
--   fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_maxRetentionDays :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the number of days
--   before the lock date. For example, setting <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt>
--   to 30 on Jan. 1, 2022 at 8pm UTC will set the lock date to Jan. 31,
--   2022 at 8pm UTC.
--   
--   Backup enforces a 72-hour cooling-off period before Vault Lock takes
--   effect and becomes immutable. Therefore, you must set
--   <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt> to 3 or greater.
--   
--   Before the lock date, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using
--   <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the Vault Lock
--   configuration using <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt>. On and
--   after the lock date, the Vault Lock becomes immutable and cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, you can delete Vault Lock from the
--   vault using <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the
--   Vault Lock configuration using
--   <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> at any time.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_changeableForDays :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the minimum
--   retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This
--   setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies
--   require you to retain certain data for at least seven years (2555
--   days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   minimum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault
--   fails that backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_minRetentionDays :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the name of the
--   backup vault it protects.
putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_backupVaultName :: Lens' PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration Text

-- | Contains a string with the supported Amazon Web Services resource
--   types:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>FSX</tt> for Amazon FSx</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
getSupportedResourceTypesResponse_resourceTypes :: Lens' GetSupportedResourceTypesResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The response's http status code.
getSupportedResourceTypesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetSupportedResourceTypesResponse Int

-- | The next item following a partial list of returned items. For example,
--   if a request is made to return <tt>maxResults</tt> number of items,
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> allows you to return more items in your list
--   starting at the location pointed to by the next token.
listRecoveryPointsByBackupVaultResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVaultResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listRecoveryPointsByBackupVaultResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVaultResponse Int

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
putBackupVaultAccessPolicy_backupVaultName :: Lens' PutBackupVaultAccessPolicy Text

--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
deleteBackupVaultAccessPolicy_backupVaultName :: Lens' DeleteBackupVaultAccessPolicy Text

-- | Specifies an object containing resource type and backup options. The
--   only supported resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see
--   the <a>sample CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS</a> in the
--   <i>Backup User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>EC2</tt>.
advancedBackupSetting_resourceType :: Lens' AdvancedBackupSetting (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows VSS backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup.
--   The <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   If you specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
--   
--   For more information about Windows VSS backups, see <a>Creating a
--   VSS-Enabled Windows Backup</a>.
advancedBackupSetting_backupOptions :: Lens' AdvancedBackupSetting (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point.
--   IAM roles other than the default role must include either
--   <tt>AWSBackup</tt> or <tt>AwsBackup</tt> in the role name. For
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess</tt>.
--   Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup
--   jobs.
backupJob_iamRoleArn :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of a resource recovery point.
backupJob_state :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe BackupJobState)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is
--   Amazon EC2.
backupJob_resourceType :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
backupJob_percentDone :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)
--   when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
backupJob_startBy :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
backupJob_createdBy :: Lens' BackupJob (Maybe RecoveryPointCreator)

--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

-- | Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a
--   selection of resources.
backupRule_ruleId :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
backupRule_lifecycle :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that
--   are associated with this rule when restored from backup.
backupRule_recoveryPointTags :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup
--   job. For more information about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule
--   Expressions for Rules</a> in the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User
--   Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a value for this parameter, we
--   recommend testing your cron expression using one of the many available
--   cron generator and testing tools.
backupRule_scheduleExpression :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes
--   Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore
--   (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot
--   backups.
backupRule_enableContinuousBackup :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Bool)

-- | A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before
--   it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is
--   optional.
backupRule_completionWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Integer)

-- | An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
backupRule_copyActions :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe [CopyAction])

-- | A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be
--   canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.
backupRule_startWindowMinutes :: Lens' BackupRule (Maybe Integer)

-- | An optional display name for a backup rule.
backupRule_ruleName :: Lens' BackupRule Text

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup

--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
backupRule_targetBackupVaultName :: Lens' BackupRule Text

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.

-- | The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration becomes
--   immutable, meaning it cannot be changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock
--   from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
backupVaultListMember_lockDate :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention
--   period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite
--   storage).
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the
--   maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than
--   that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy
--   job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a
--   different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to
--   Vault Lock are not affected.
backupVaultListMember_maxRetentionDays :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe Integer)

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock applies to
--   the selected backup vault. If <tt>true</tt>, Vault Lock prevents
--   delete and update operations on the recovery points in the selected
--   vault.
backupVaultListMember_locked :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe Bool)

-- | A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests
--   to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice.
backupVaultListMember_creatorRequestId :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.
backupVaultListMember_numberOfRecoveryPoints :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe Integer)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
backupVaultListMember_backupVaultArn :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe Text)

--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.

--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
backupVaultListMember_backupVaultName :: Lens' BackupVaultListMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention
--   period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter
--   is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention
--   period.
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the
--   minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter
--   than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or
--   copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use
--   a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior
--   to Vault Lock are not affected.

-- | The date and time a copy job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
copyJob_completionDate :: Lens' CopyJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
framework_creationTime :: Lens' Framework (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An optional description of the framework with a maximum 1,024
--   characters.
framework_frameworkDescription :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of controls contained by the framework.
framework_numberOfControls :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Int)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
framework_frameworkArn :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment status of a framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
framework_deploymentStatus :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
framework_frameworkName :: Lens' Framework (Maybe Text)

-- | The scope of a control. The control scope defines what the control
--   will evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans. For
--   more information, see <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
frameworkControl_controlScope :: Lens' FrameworkControl (Maybe ControlScope)

-- | A list of <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
frameworkControl_controlInputParameters :: Lens' FrameworkControl (Maybe [ControlInputParameter])

-- | The name of a control. This name is between 1 and 256 characters.
frameworkControl_controlName :: Lens' FrameworkControl Text

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   moved to cold storage.
lifecycle_moveToColdStorageAfterDays :: Lens' Lifecycle (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is
--   deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
lifecycle_deleteAfterDays :: Lens' Lifecycle (Maybe Integer)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
protectedResource_resourceType :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time a resource was last backed up, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
protectedResource_lastBackupTime :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
protectedResource_resourceArn :: Lens' ProtectedResource (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value that is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified
--   recovery point is encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point
--   is not encrypted.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_isEncrypted :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Bool)

-- | A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_status :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe RecoveryPointStatus)

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_iamRoleArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services resource saved as a recovery point;
--   for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an
--   Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows
--   Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource
--   type is Amazon EC2.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceType :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery
--   point, including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_createdBy :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe RecoveryPointCreator)

-- | A <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_calculatedLifecycle :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe CalculatedLifecycle)

-- | The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_lifecycle :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Lifecycle)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The backup vault where the recovery point was originally copied from.
--   If the recovery point is restored to the same account this value will
--   be <tt>null</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_sourceBackupVaultArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format
--   and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_lastRestoreTime :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | A message explaining the reason of the recovery point deletion
--   failure.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_statusMessage :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery
--   point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups;
--   for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_encryptionKeyArn :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of a backup.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupSizeInBytes :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>

recoveryPointByBackupVault_creationDate :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe UTCTime)

recoveryPointByBackupVault_completionDate :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup
--   vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to
--   create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created.
--   They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultName :: Lens' RecoveryPointByBackupVault (Maybe Text)

-- | The prefix for where Backup Audit Manager delivers your reports to
--   Amazon S3. The prefix is this part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
reportDeliveryChannel_s3KeyPrefix :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the format of your reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or
--   both. If not specified, the default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.
reportDeliveryChannel_formats :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel (Maybe [Text])

-- | The unique name of the S3 bucket that receives your reports.
reportDeliveryChannel_s3BucketName :: Lens' ReportDeliveryChannel Text

--   bucket.

reportDestination_s3BucketName :: Lens' ReportDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportJob_creationTime :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.

--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportJob_completionTime :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe UTCTime)

--   Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report
--   job IDs cannot be edited.
reportJob_reportJobId :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | A message explaining the status of the report job.
reportJob_statusMessage :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 bucket name and S3 keys for the destination where the report
--   job publishes the report.
reportJob_reportDestination :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe ReportDestination)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
reportJob_reportTemplate :: Lens' ReportJob (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportPlan_creationTime :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
reportPlan_reportPlanName :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
reportPlan_reportPlanArn :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.

--   characters.
reportPlan_reportPlanDescription :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan

--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
reportPlan_lastAttemptedExecutionTime :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The deployment status of a report plan. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED
--   </pre>
reportPlan_deploymentStatus :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe Text)

--   last successfully ran, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time

--   specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the
--   formats of your reports.
reportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel :: Lens' ReportPlan (Maybe ReportDeliveryChannel)

reportSetting_frameworkArns :: Lens' ReportSetting (Maybe [Text])

-- | The number of frameworks a report covers.
reportSetting_numberOfFrameworks :: Lens' ReportSetting (Maybe Int)

-- | Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using
--   a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
reportSetting_reportTemplate :: Lens' ReportSetting Text

-- | A status code specifying the state of the job initiated by Backup to
--   restore a recovery point.
restoreJobsListMember_status :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe RestoreJobStatus)

-- | Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point;
--   for example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
restoreJobsListMember_iamRoleArn :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is
--   expected to take.

-- | Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.
restoreJobsListMember_restoreJobId :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource type of the listed restore jobs; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
restoreJobsListMember_resourceType :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

restoreJobsListMember_percentDone :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

restoreJobsListMember_accountId :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
restoreJobsListMember_createdResourceArn :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

-- | A detailed message explaining the status of the job to restore a
--   recovery point.
restoreJobsListMember_statusMessage :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

-- | An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
restoreJobsListMember_recoveryPointArn :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Text)

-- | The size, in bytes, of the restored resource.
restoreJobsListMember_backupSizeInBytes :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe Integer)

-- | The date and time a restore job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
restoreJobsListMember_creationDate :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe UTCTime)

--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087

restoreJobsListMember_completionDate :: Lens' RestoreJobsListMember (Maybe UTCTime)


module Network.AWS.Backup.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2018-11-15</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Backup
--   
--   Backup is a unified backup service designed to protect Amazon Web
--   Services services and their associated data. Backup simplifies the
--   creation, migration, restoration, and deletion of backups, while also
--   providing reporting and auditing.
module Network.AWS.Backup

-- | API version <tt>2018-11-15</tt> of the Amazon Backup SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For
--   example, a parameter is of the wrong type.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A dependent Amazon Web Services service or resource returned an error
--   to the Backup service, and the action cannot be completed.
_DependencyFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Backup is already performing an action on this recovery point. It
--   can't perform the action you requested until the first action
--   finishes. Try again later.
_InvalidResourceStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Backup can't perform the action that you requested until it finishes
--   performing a previous action. Try again later.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For
--   example, the value is out of range.
_InvalidParameterValueException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The required resource already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum
--   number of items allowed in a request.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
_MissingParameterValueException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBackupPlan</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateBackupPlan
UpdateBackupPlan' :: Text -> BackupPlanInput -> UpdateBackupPlan

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBackupPlan</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanId:UpdateBackupPlan'</a>,

--   plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlan:UpdateBackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackupPlan_backupPlan</a> - Specifies the body of a backup
--   plan. Includes a <tt>BackupPlanName</tt> and one or more sets of
--   <tt>Rules</tt>.
newUpdateBackupPlan :: Text -> BackupPlanInput -> UpdateBackupPlan

--   fields omitted.

--   <a>updateBackupPlanResponse_advancedBackupSettings</a> - Contains a

--   backup plan.

--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:UpdateBackupPlanResponse'</a>,

--   backup plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateBackupPlanResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateBackupPlanResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newUpdateBackupPlanResponse :: Int -> UpdateBackupPlanResponse

--   <a>describeBackupJobResponse_startBy</a> - Specifies the time in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be
--   started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the
--   start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00
--   PM and the start window is 2 hours, the <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be
--   8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeRecoveryPointResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEncrypted:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_isEncrypted</a> - A Boolean value
--   that is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified recovery point is
--   encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point is not encrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_status</a> - A status code specifying
--   the state of the recovery point.
--   
--   <tt>PARTIAL</tt> status indicates Backup could not create the recovery
--   point before the backup window closed. To increase your backup plan
--   window using the API, see <a>UpdateBackupPlan</a>. You can also
--   increase your backup plan window using the Console by choosing and
--   editing your backup plan.
--   
--   <tt>EXPIRED</tt> status indicates that the recovery point has exceeded
--   its retention period, but Backup lacks permission or is otherwise
--   unable to delete it. To manually delete these recovery points, see
--   <a>Step 3: Delete the recovery points</a> in the <i>Clean up
--   resources</i> section of <i>Getting started</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM
--   role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_resourceType</a> - The type of Amazon
--   Web Services resource to save as a recovery point; for example, an
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_createdBy</a> - Contains identifying
--   information about the creation of a recovery point, including the
--   <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:calculatedLifecycle:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_calculatedLifecycle</a> - A
--   <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_lifecycle</a> - The lifecycle defines
--   when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it
--   expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically
--   according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups that are transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold
--   storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days”
--   setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after
--   days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be
--   changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_backupVaultArn</a> - An ARN that
--   uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_sourceBackupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the source vault where
--   the resource was originally backed up in; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:BackupVault</tt>. If
--   the recovery is restored to the same Amazon Web Services account or
--   Region, this value will be <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRestoreTime:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_lastRestoreTime</a> - The date and
--   time that a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_resourceArn</a> - An ARN that
--   uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the ARN depends on
--   the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_statusMessage</a> - A status message
--   explaining the reason for the recovery point deletion failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_storageClass</a> - Specifies the
--   storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are <tt>WARM</tt> or
--   <tt>COLD</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:DescribeRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_recoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that
--   uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionKeyArn:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_encryptionKeyArn</a> - The
--   server-side encryption key used to protect your backups; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in
--   bytes, of a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time
--   that a recovery point is created, in Unix format and Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate
--   to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents
--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_completionDate</a> - The date and
--   time that a job to create a recovery point is completed, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeRecoveryPoint'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase
--   letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeRecoveryPointResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeRecoveryPointResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

--   Returns only report jobs that are in the specified status. The
--   statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:byReportPlanName:ListReportJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listReportJobs_byReportPlanName</a> - Returns only report jobs with
--   the specified report plan name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListReportJobs'</a>, <a>listReportJobs_nextToken</a>
--   - An identifier that was returned from the previous call to this
--   operation, which can be used to return the next set of items in the
--   list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:byCreationBefore:ListReportJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listReportJobs_byCreationBefore</a> - Returns only report jobs that
--   were created before the date and time specified in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). For example, the value 1516925490
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:byCreationAfter:ListReportJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listReportJobs_byCreationAfter</a> - Returns only report jobs that
--   were created after the date and time specified in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). For example, the value 1516925490
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListReportJobs'</a>,
--   <a>listReportJobs_maxResults</a> - The number of desired results from
--   1 to 1000. Optional. If unspecified, the query will return 1 MB of
--   data.
newListReportJobs :: ListReportJobs

--   that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to
--   <tt>CreateReportPlanInput</tt>. Retrying a successful request with the
--   same idempotency token results in a success message with no action
--   taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanTags:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_reportPlanTags</a> - Metadata that you can assign
--   to help organize the report plans that you create. Each tag is a
--   key-value pair.

--   description of the report plan with a maximum of 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanName:CreateReportPlan'</a>,

--   plan. The name must be between 1 and 256 characters, starting with a
--   letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and
--   underscores (_).
--

--   <a>createReportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel</a> - A structure that
--   contains information about where and how to deliver your reports,
--   specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the
--   formats of your reports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportSetting:CreateReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>createReportPlan_reportSetting</a> - Identifies the report template
--   for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report
--   templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
newCreateReportPlan :: Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel -> ReportSetting -> CreateReportPlan

data StartBackupJob
StartBackupJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartBackupJob

-- | Create a value of <a>StartBackupJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_idempotencyToken</a> - A customer-chosen string that
--   you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to
--   <tt>StartBackupJob</tt>. Retrying a successful request with the same
--   idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:StartBackupJob'</a>, <a>startBackupJob_lifecycle</a>
--   - The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointTags:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_recoveryPointTags</a> - To help organize your
--   resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you
--   create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completeWindowMinutes:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_completeWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes
--   during which a successfully started backup must complete, or else AWS
--   Backup will cancel the job. This value is optional. This value begins
--   counting down from when the backup was scheduled. It does not add
--   additional time for <tt>StartWindowMinutes</tt>, or if the backup
--   started later than scheduled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_backupOptions</a> - Specifies the backup option for
--   a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS""disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. The
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startWindowMinutes:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_startWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start
--   successfully. This value is optional, and the default is 8 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_resourceArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that
--   uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the
--   resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:StartBackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>startBackupJob_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM role ARN used to
--   create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.

--   consists of one or more controls. Each control governs a resource,
--   such as backup plans, backup selections, backup vaults, or recovery
--   points. You can also turn Config recording on or off for each
--   resource. The statuses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned on for all resources
--   governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>PARTIALLY_ACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned off for at
--   least one resource governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>INACTIVE</tt> when recording is turned off for all resources
--   governed by the framework.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> when Backup is unable to validate recording
--   status at this time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkControls:DescribeFrameworkResponse'</a>,

--   controls that make up the framework. Each control in the list has a
--   name, input parameters, and scope.
--

--   depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentStatus:DescribeFrameworkResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeFrameworkResponse_deploymentStatus</a> - The deployment
--   status of a framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkName:DescribeFramework'</a>,

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeBackupVaultResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeBackupVaultResponse
DescribeBackupVaultResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Int -> DescribeBackupVaultResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeBackupVaultResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lockDate:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_lockDate</a> - The date and time when
--   Backup Vault Lock configuration cannot be changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change any of your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault
--   Lock from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRetentionDays:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_maxRetentionDays</a> - The Backup Vault
--   Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention period that the
--   vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified,
--   Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery
--   points in the vault (allowing indefinite storage).
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the
--   maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than
--   that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy
--   job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a
--   different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to
--   Vault Lock are not affected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locked:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_locked</a> - A Boolean that indicates
--   whether Backup Vault Lock is currently protecting the backup vault.
--   <tt>True</tt> means that Vault Lock causes delete or update operations
--   on the recovery points stored in the vault to fail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creatorRequestId:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_creatorRequestId</a> - A unique string
--   that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried
--   without the risk of running the operation twice.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRecoveryPoints:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_numberOfRecoveryPoints</a> - The number
--   of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_backupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionKeyArn:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_encryptionKeyArn</a> - The server-side
--   encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_creationDate</a> - The date and time
--   that a backup vault is created, in Unix format and Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate
--   to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents
--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:DescribeBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase
--   letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minRetentionDays:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_minRetentionDays</a> - The Backup Vault
--   Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention period that the
--   vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified,
--   Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention period.
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the
--   minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter
--   than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or
--   copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use
--   a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior
--   to Vault Lock are not affected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeBackupVaultResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeBackupVaultResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeBackupVaultResponse :: Int -> DescribeBackupVaultResponse

data StartRestoreJob
StartRestoreJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Sensitive (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> StartRestoreJob

-- | Create a value of <a>StartRestoreJob</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:idempotencyToken:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_idempotencyToken</a> - A customer-chosen string
--   that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to
--   <tt>StartRestoreJob</tt>. Retrying a successful request with the same
--   idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_resourceType</a> - Starts a job to restore a
--   recovery point for one of the following resources:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DynamoDB</tt> for Amazon DynamoDB</li>
--   <li><tt>EBS</tt> for Amazon Elastic Block Store</li>
--   <li><tt>EC2</tt> for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud</li>
--   <li><tt>EFS</tt> for Amazon Elastic File System</li>
--   <li><tt>RDS</tt> for Amazon Relational Database Service</li>
--   <li><tt>Aurora</tt> for Amazon Aurora</li>
--   <li><tt>Storage Gateway</tt> for Storage Gateway</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_recoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:StartRestoreJob'</a>, <a>startRestoreJob_metadata</a>
--   - A set of metadata key-value pairs. Contains information, such as a
--   resource name, required to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   You can get configuration metadata about a resource at the time it was
--   backed up by calling <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.
--   However, values in addition to those provided by
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt> might be required to restore
--   a resource. For example, you might need to provide a new resource name
--   if the original already exists.
--   
--   You need to specify specific metadata to restore an Amazon Elastic
--   File System (Amazon EFS) instance:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>file-system-id</tt>: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that
--   is backed up by Backup. Returned in
--   <tt>GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>Encrypted</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that
--   the file system is encrypted. If <tt>KmsKeyId</tt> is specified,
--   <tt>Encrypted</tt> must be set to <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>KmsKeyId</tt>: Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key that
--   is used to encrypt the restored file system. You can specify a key
--   from another Amazon Web Services account provided that key it is
--   properly shared with your account via Amazon Web Services KMS.</li>
--   <li><tt>PerformanceMode</tt>: Specifies the throughput mode of the
--   file system.</li>
--   <li><tt>CreationToken</tt>: A user-supplied value that ensures the
--   uniqueness (idempotency) of the request.</li>
--   <li><tt>newFileSystem</tt>: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies
--   that the recovery point is restored to a new Amazon EFS file
--   system.</li>
--   <li><tt>ItemsToRestore</tt>: An array of one to five strings where
--   each string is a file path. Use <tt>ItemsToRestore</tt> to restore
--   specific files or directories rather than the entire file system. This
--   parameter is optional. For example,
--   <tt>"itemsToRestore":"[\"/my.test\"]"</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:StartRestoreJob'</a>,
--   <a>startRestoreJob_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the IAM role that Backup uses to create the target recovery point; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
newStartRestoreJob :: Text -> Text -> StartRestoreJob

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_lifecycle</a> - The lifecycle defines
--   when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it
--   expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically
--   according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They
--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>updateRecoveryPointLifecycle_recoveryPointArn</a> - An Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
newUpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle :: Text -> Text -> UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle

--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sNSTopicArn:PutBackupVaultNotifications'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultNotifications_sNSTopicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that specifies the topic for a backup vault’s events; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:111122223333:MyVaultTopic</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultEvents:PutBackupVaultNotifications'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultNotifications_backupVaultEvents</a> - An array of
--   events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the
--   backup vault.
--   
--   The following events are supported:
--   
--   <tt>BACKUP_JOB_STARTED</tt>, <tt>BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED</tt>,
--   
--   <tt>COPY_JOB_STARTED</tt>, <tt>COPY_JOB_SUCCESSFUL</tt>,
--   <tt>COPY_JOB_FAILED</tt>,
--   
--   <tt>RESTORE_JOB_STARTED</tt>, <tt>RESTORE_JOB_COMPLETED</tt>, and
--   <tt>RECOVERY_POINT_MODIFIED</tt>.
--   
--   To find failed backup jobs, use <tt>BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED</tt> and
--   filter using event metadata.
--   
--   Other events in the following list are deprecated.
newPutBackupVaultNotifications :: Text -> Text -> PutBackupVaultNotifications

--   constructor.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration
PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRetentionDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_maxRetentionDays</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the maximum retention period
--   that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful
--   if, for example, your organization's policies require you to destroy
--   certain data after retaining it for four years (1460 days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not included, Vault Lock does not enforce a
--   maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault. If this
--   parameter is included without a value, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   maximum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault
--   fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:changeableForDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_changeableForDays</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the number of days before the
--   lock date. For example, setting <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt> to 30 on
--   Jan. 1, 2022 at 8pm UTC will set the lock date to Jan. 31, 2022 at 8pm
--   UTC.
--   
--   Backup enforces a 72-hour cooling-off period before Vault Lock takes
--   effect and becomes immutable. Therefore, you must set
--   <tt>ChangeableForDays</tt> to 3 or greater.
--   
--   Before the lock date, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using
--   <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the Vault Lock
--   configuration using <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt>. On and
--   after the lock date, the Vault Lock becomes immutable and cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, you can delete Vault Lock from the
--   vault using <tt>DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> or change the
--   Vault Lock configuration using
--   <tt>PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration</tt> at any time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minRetentionDays:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_minRetentionDays</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the minimum retention period
--   that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful
--   if, for example, your organization's policies require you to retain
--   certain data for at least seven years (2555 days).
--   
--   If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock will not enforce a
--   minimum retention period.
--   
--   If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault
--   must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or
--   longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention
--   period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault
--   fails that backup or copy job, and you should either modify your
--   lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already
--   saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBackupVaultLockConfiguration_backupVaultName</a> - The Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration that specifies the name of the backup vault
--   it protects.
newPutBackupVaultLockConfiguration :: Text -> PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   recovery points that were created before the specified timestamp.
--   
--   <a>$sel:byBackupPlanId:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>listRecoveryPointsByBackupVault_byBackupPlanId</a> - Returns only
--   recovery points that match the specified backup plan ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:byResourceType:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>listRecoveryPointsByBackupVault_byResourceType</a> - Returns only
--   recovery points that match the specified resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>listRecoveryPointsByBackupVault_nextToken</a> - The next item
--   following a partial list of returned items. For example, if a request
--   is made to return <tt>maxResults</tt> number of items,
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> allows you to return more items in your list
--   starting at the location pointed to by the next token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>listRecoveryPointsByBackupVault_maxResults</a> - The maximum number
--   of items to be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>listRecoveryPointsByBackupVault_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They
--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   Backup vault name might not be available when a supported service
--   creates the backup.
newListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault :: Text -> ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault
