-- | A list of backup options for each resource type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdvancedBackupSetting</a> smart constructor.
data AdvancedBackupSetting
AdvancedBackupSetting' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> AdvancedBackupSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>AdvancedBackupSetting</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:AdvancedBackupSetting'</a>,
--   <a>advancedBackupSetting_resourceType</a> - Specifies an object
--   containing resource type and backup options. The only supported
--   resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see the <a>sample
--   CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS</a> in the <i>Backup
--   User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>EC2</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:AdvancedBackupSetting'</a>,
--   <a>advancedBackupSetting_backupOptions</a> - Specifies the backup
--   option for a selected resource. This option is only available for
--   Windows VSS backup jobs.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
--   
--   Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup.
--   The <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> option is not enabled by default.
--   
--   If you specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
--   
--   For more information about Windows VSS backups, see <a>Creating a
--   VSS-Enabled Windows Backup</a>.
newAdvancedBackupSetting :: AdvancedBackupSetting

-- | Contains detailed information about a backup job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupJob</a> smart constructor.
data BackupJob
BackupJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BackupJobState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> BackupJob

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_iamRoleArn</a> -
--   Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point.
--   IAM roles other than the default role must include either
--   <tt>AWSBackup</tt> or <tt>AwsBackup</tt> in the role name. For
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess</tt>.
--   Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_state</a> - The current
--   state of a resource recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_resourceType</a> -
--   The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example,
--   an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume
--   Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is
--   Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentDone:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_percentDone</a> -
--   Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job
--   status was queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startBy:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_startBy</a> - Specifies
--   the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a
--   backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is
--   calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the
--   scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the
--   <tt>StartBy</tt> time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The
--   value of <tt>StartBy</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example,
--   the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_createdBy</a> -
--   Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job,
--   including the <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan used to create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedCompletionDate:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_expectedCompletionDate</a> - The date and time a job to
--   back up resources is expected to be completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>ExpectedCompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesTransferred:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_bytesTransferred</a> - The size in bytes transferred to a
--   backup vault at the time that the job status was queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupVaultArn</a>
--   - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup
--   vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_accountId</a> - The
--   account ID that owns the backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupJobId:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupJobId</a> -
--   Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_resourceArn</a> - An
--   ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends
--   on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_statusMessage</a> -
--   A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_recoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely identifies a
--   recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_creationDate</a> -
--   The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_completionDate</a>
--   - The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix
--   format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>CompletionDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the
--   value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087
--   AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:BackupJob'</a>,
--   <a>backupJob_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical container
--   where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that
--   are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web
--   Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase
--   letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupType:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupType</a> -
--   Represents the type of backup for a backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupOptions:BackupJob'</a>, <a>backupJob_backupOptions</a> -
--   Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is
--   only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup
--   jobs.
--   
--   Valid values: Set to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"enabled"</tt> to enable the
--   <tt>WindowsVSS</tt> backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set
--   to <tt>"WindowsVSS":"disabled"</tt> to create a regular backup. If you
--   specify an invalid option, you get an
--   <tt>InvalidParameterValueException</tt> exception.
newBackupJob :: BackupJob

-- | Contains an optional backup plan display name and an array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a backup rule.
--   Each rule in a backup plan is a separate scheduled task and can back
--   up a different selection of Amazon Web Services resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupPlan</a> smart constructor.
data BackupPlan
BackupPlan' :: Maybe [AdvancedBackupSetting] -> Text -> [BackupRule] -> BackupPlan

--   <tt>BackupOptions</tt> for each resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupPlanName:BackupPlan'</a>,
--   <a>backupPlan_backupPlanName</a> - The display name of a backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:BackupPlan'</a>, <a>backupPlan_rules</a> - An array of
--   <tt>BackupRule</tt> objects, each of which specifies a scheduled task
--   that is used to back up a selection of resources.
newBackupPlan :: Text -> BackupPlan

-- | Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRule</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRule
BackupRule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [CopyAction] -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> BackupRule

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleId:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_ruleId</a> - Uniquely
--   identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a selection
--   of resources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_lifecycle</a> - The
--   lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold
--   storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups
--   automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_recoveryPointTags</a> - An array of key-value pair
--   strings that are assigned to resources that are associated with this
--   rule when restored from backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_scheduleExpression</a> - A cron expression in UTC
--   specifying when Backup initiates a backup job. For more information
--   about cron expressions, see <a>Schedule Expressions for Rules</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide.</i>. Prior to specifying a
--   value for this parameter, we recommend testing your cron expression
--   using one of the many available cron generator and testing tools.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_enableContinuousBackup</a> - Specifies whether Backup
--   creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create continuous
--   backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or not
--   specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_completionWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it
--   will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyActions:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_copyActions</a> -
--   An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt> objects, which contains the details of
--   the copy operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_startWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start
--   successfully. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleName:BackupRule'</a>, <a>backupRule_ruleName</a> - An
--   optional display name for a backup rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRule'</a>,
--   <a>backupRule_targetBackupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newBackupRule :: Text -> Text -> BackupRule

-- | Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupRuleInput</a> smart constructor.
data BackupRuleInput
BackupRuleInput' :: Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe (Sensitive (HashMap Text Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe [CopyAction] -> Maybe Integer -> Text -> Text -> BackupRuleInput

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupRuleInput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_lifecycle</a> - The lifecycle defines when a
--   protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it
--   expires. Backup will transition and expire backups automatically
--   according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointTags:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_recoveryPointTags</a> - To help organize your
--   resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you
--   create. Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleExpression:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_scheduleExpression</a> - A CRON expression in UTC
--   specifying when Backup initiates a backup job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableContinuousBackup:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_enableContinuousBackup</a> - Specifies whether
--   Backup creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create
--   continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or
--   not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_completionWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes
--   after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed
--   or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyActions:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_copyActions</a> - An array of <tt>CopyAction</tt>
--   objects, which contains the details of the copy operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startWindowMinutes:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_startWindowMinutes</a> - A value in minutes after a
--   backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start
--   successfully. This value is optional.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleName:BackupRuleInput'</a>, <a>backupRuleInput_ruleName</a>
--   - An optional display name for a backup rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetBackupVaultName:BackupRuleInput'</a>,
--   <a>backupRuleInput_targetBackupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newBackupRuleInput :: Text -> Text -> BackupRuleInput

-- | Used to specify a set of resources to a backup plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupSelection</a> smart constructor.
data BackupSelection
BackupSelection' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Condition] -> Text -> Text -> BackupSelection

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupSelection</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_resources</a> - An array of strings that contain
--   Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of resources to assign to a backup plan.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listOfTags:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_listOfTags</a> - An array of conditions used to
--   specify a set of resources to assign to a backup plan; for example,
--   <tt>"StringEquals": {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>.
--   Assigns the backup plan to every resource with at least one matching
--   tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectionName:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_selectionName</a> - The display name of a resource
--   selection document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:BackupSelection'</a>,
--   <a>backupSelection_iamRoleArn</a> - The ARN of the IAM role that
--   Backup uses to authenticate when backing up the target resource; for
--   example, <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
newBackupSelection :: Text -> Text -> BackupSelection

--   without the risk of running the operation twice.

--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
newBackupSelectionsListMember :: BackupSelectionsListMember

-- | Contains metadata about a backup vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackupVaultListMember</a> smart constructor.
data BackupVaultListMember
BackupVaultListMember' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> BackupVaultListMember

-- | Create a value of <a>BackupVaultListMember</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lockDate:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_lockDate</a> - The date and time when Backup
--   Vault Lock configuration becomes immutable, meaning it cannot be
--   changed or deleted.
--   
--   If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock
--   date, you can change your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock
--   from the vault entirely, at any time.
--   
--   This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxRetentionDays:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_maxRetentionDays</a> - The Backup Vault Lock
--   setting that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault
--   retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault
--   Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery
--   points in the vault (allowing indefinite storage).
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the
--   maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than
--   that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy
--   job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a
--   different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to
--   Vault Lock are not affected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:locked:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_locked</a> - A Boolean value that indicates
--   whether Backup Vault Lock applies to the selected backup vault. If
--   <tt>true</tt>, Vault Lock prevents delete and update operations on the
--   recovery points in the selected vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creatorRequestId:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_creatorRequestId</a> - A unique string that
--   identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried
--   without the risk of running the operation twice.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRecoveryPoints:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_numberOfRecoveryPoints</a> - The number of
--   recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_backupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionKeyArn:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_encryptionKeyArn</a> - The server-side
--   encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_creationDate</a> - The date and time a
--   resource backup is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal
--   Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a logical
--   container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by
--   names that are unique to the account used to create them and the
--   Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minRetentionDays:BackupVaultListMember'</a>,
--   <a>backupVaultListMember_minRetentionDays</a> - The Backup Vault Lock
--   setting that specifies the minimum retention period that the vault
--   retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault
--   Lock does not enforce a minimum retention period.
--   
--   If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a
--   lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the
--   minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter
--   than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or
--   copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use
--   a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior
--   to Vault Lock are not affected.
newBackupVaultListMember :: BackupVaultListMember

-- | Contains <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt>
--   timestamps, which are used to specify a lifecycle for a recovery
--   point.
--   
--   The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to
--   cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires
--   backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCalculatedLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data CalculatedLifecycle
CalculatedLifecycle' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CalculatedLifecycle

-- | Create a value of <a>CalculatedLifecycle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAt:CalculatedLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>calculatedLifecycle_deleteAt</a> - A timestamp that specifies when
--   to delete a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:moveToColdStorageAt:CalculatedLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>calculatedLifecycle_moveToColdStorageAt</a> - A timestamp that
--   specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold storage.
newCalculatedLifecycle :: CalculatedLifecycle

-- | Contains an array of triplets made up of a condition type (such as
--   <tt>StringEquals</tt>), a key, and a value. Conditions are used to
--   filter resources in a selection that is assigned to a backup plan.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: ConditionType -> Text -> Text -> Condition

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionType:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionType</a> -
--   An operation, such as <tt>StringEquals</tt>, that is applied to a
--   key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionKey:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionKey</a> -
--   The key in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department"</tt> is the key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:conditionValue:Condition'</a>, <a>condition_conditionValue</a>
--   - The value in a key-value pair. For example, in
--   <tt>"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting"</tt>,
--   <tt>"accounting"</tt> is the value.
newCondition :: ConditionType -> Text -> Text -> Condition

-- | A list of parameters for a control. A control can have zero, one, or
--   more than one parameter. An example of a control with two parameters
--   is: "backup plan frequency is at least <tt>daily</tt> and the
--   retention period is at least <tt>1 year</tt>". The first parameter is
--   <tt>daily</tt>. The second parameter is <tt>1 year</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newControlInputParameter</a> smart constructor.
data ControlInputParameter
ControlInputParameter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ControlInputParameter

-- | Create a value of <a>ControlInputParameter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterValue:ControlInputParameter'</a>,
--   <a>controlInputParameter_parameterValue</a> - The value of parameter,
--   for example, <tt>hourly</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameterName:ControlInputParameter'</a>,
--   <a>controlInputParameter_parameterName</a> - The name of a parameter,
--   for example, <tt>BackupPlanFrequency</tt>.
newControlInputParameter :: ControlInputParameter

-- | A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control has its own
--   control scope. The control scope defines what the control will
--   evaluate. Three examples of control scopes are: a specific backup
--   plan, all backup plans with a specific tag, or all backup plans.
--   
--   To set a control scope that includes all of a particular resource,
--   leave the <tt>ControlScope</tt> empty or do not pass it when calling
--   <tt>CreateFramework</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newControlScope</a> smart constructor.
data ControlScope
ControlScope' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> ControlScope

-- | Create a value of <a>ControlScope</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceResourceTypes:ControlScope'</a>,
--   <a>controlScope_complianceResourceTypes</a> - Describes whether the
--   control scope includes one or more types of resources, such as
--   <tt>EFS</tt> or <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ControlScope'</a>, <a>controlScope_tags</a> - Describes
--   whether the control scope includes resources with one or more tags.
--   Each tag is a key-value pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:complianceResourceIds:ControlScope'</a>,
--   <a>controlScope_complianceResourceIds</a> - The ID of the only Amazon
--   Web Services resource that you want your control scope to contain.
newControlScope :: ControlScope

-- | The details of the copy operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyAction</a> smart constructor.
data CopyAction

-- | Contains detailed information about a copy job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyJob</a> smart constructor.
data CopyJob
CopyJob' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe CopyJobState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> CopyJob

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies
--   the IAM role ARN used to copy the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_state</a> - The current state
--   of a copy job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceRecoveryPointArn:CopyJob'</a>,
--   <a>copyJob_sourceRecoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a source recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_resourceType</a> - The
--   type of Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationBackupVaultArn:CopyJob'</a>,
--   <a>copyJob_destinationBackupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies a destination copy vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_createdBy</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationRecoveryPointArn:CopyJob'</a>,
--   <a>copyJob_destinationRecoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a destination recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_accountId</a> - The account
--   ID that owns the copy job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:CopyJob'</a>,
--   <a>copyJob_sourceBackupVaultArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   that uniquely identifies a source copy vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copyJobId:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_copyJobId</a> - Uniquely
--   identifies a copy job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_resourceArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Web Services resource to be copied; for example, an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_statusMessage</a> - A
--   detailed message explaining the status of the job to copy a resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:CopyJob'</a>,
--   <a>copyJob_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes, of a copy job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_creationDate</a> - The
--   date and time a copy job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate
--   to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents
--   Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:CopyJob'</a>, <a>copyJob_completionDate</a> -
--   The date and time a copy job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
newCopyJob :: CopyJob

-- | Contains detailed information about a framework. Frameworks contain
--   controls, which evaluate and report on your backup events and
--   resources. Frameworks generate daily compliance results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFramework</a> smart constructor.
data Framework
Framework' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Framework

-- | Create a value of <a>Framework</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a framework is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkDescription:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_frameworkDescription</a> - An optional description of the
--   framework with a maximum 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfControls:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_numberOfControls</a> - The number of controls contained
--   by the framework.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkArn:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_frameworkArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentStatus:Framework'</a>,
--   <a>framework_deploymentStatus</a> - The deployment status of a
--   framework. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkName:Framework'</a>, <a>framework_frameworkName</a> -
--   The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256
--   characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z,
--   A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
newFramework :: Framework

-- | Contains detailed information about all of the controls of a
--   framework. Each framework must contain at least one control.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFrameworkControl</a> smart constructor.
data FrameworkControl
FrameworkControl' :: Maybe ControlScope -> Maybe [ControlInputParameter] -> Text -> FrameworkControl

-- | Create a value of <a>FrameworkControl</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlScope:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlScope</a> - The scope of a control. The
--   control scope defines what the control will evaluate. Three examples
--   of control scopes are: a specific backup plan, all backup plans with a
--   specific tag, or all backup plans. For more information, see
--   <tt>ControlScope</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlInputParameters:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlInputParameters</a> - A list of
--   <tt>ParameterName</tt> and <tt>ParameterValue</tt> pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:controlName:FrameworkControl'</a>,
--   <a>frameworkControl_controlName</a> - The name of a control. This name
--   is between 1 and 256 characters.
newFrameworkControl :: Text -> FrameworkControl

-- | Contains an array of <tt>Transition</tt> objects specifying how long
--   in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is
--   deleted.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, on the console, the “expire after
--   days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold
--   after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting
--   cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data Lifecycle
Lifecycle' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Lifecycle

-- | Create a value of <a>Lifecycle</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:moveToColdStorageAfterDays:Lifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycle_moveToColdStorageAfterDays</a> - Specifies the number of
--   days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteAfterDays:Lifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycle_deleteAfterDays</a> - Specifies the number of days after
--   creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90
--   days plus <tt>MoveToColdStorageAfterDays</tt>.
newLifecycle :: Lifecycle

-- | A structure that contains information about a backed-up resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProtectedResource</a> smart constructor.
data ProtectedResource
ProtectedResource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ProtectedResource

-- | Create a value of <a>ProtectedResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_resourceType</a> - The type of Amazon Web
--   Services resource; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon
--   EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
--   database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the
--   only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastBackupTime:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_lastBackupTime</a> - The date and time a resource
--   was last backed up, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>LastBackupTime</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:ProtectedResource'</a>,
--   <a>protectedResource_resourceArn</a> - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on
--   the resource type.
newProtectedResource :: ProtectedResource

-- | Contains detailed information about the recovery points stored in a
--   backup vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecoveryPointByBackupVault</a> smart constructor.
data RecoveryPointByBackupVault
RecoveryPointByBackupVault' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe RecoveryPointStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RecoveryPointCreator -> Maybe CalculatedLifecycle -> Maybe Lifecycle -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> RecoveryPointByBackupVault

-- | Create a value of <a>RecoveryPointByBackupVault</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEncrypted:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_isEncrypted</a> - A Boolean value that
--   is returned as <tt>TRUE</tt> if the specified recovery point is
--   encrypted, or <tt>FALSE</tt> if the recovery point is not encrypted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_status</a> - A status code specifying
--   the state of the recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM role
--   ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceType</a> - The type of Amazon
--   Web Services resource saved as a recovery point; for example, an
--   Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational
--   Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy
--   Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_createdBy</a> - Contains identifying
--   information about the creation of a recovery point, including the
--   <tt>BackupPlanArn</tt>, <tt>BackupPlanId</tt>,
--   <tt>BackupPlanVersion</tt>, and <tt>BackupRuleId</tt> of the backup
--   plan that is used to create it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:calculatedLifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_calculatedLifecycle</a> - A
--   <tt>CalculatedLifecycle</tt> object containing <tt>DeleteAt</tt> and
--   <tt>MoveToColdStorageAt</tt> timestamps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycle:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_lifecycle</a> - The lifecycle defines
--   when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it
--   expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically
--   according to the lifecycle that you define.
--   
--   Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage
--   for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting
--   must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”
--   setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed
--   after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
--   
--   Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold
--   storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultArn</a> - An ARN that
--   uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceBackupVaultArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_sourceBackupVaultArn</a> - The backup
--   vault where the recovery point was originally copied from. If the
--   recovery point is restored to the same account this value will be
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastRestoreTime:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_lastRestoreTime</a> - The date and time
--   a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>LastRestoreTime</tt> is
--   accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_resourceArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_statusMessage</a> - A message explaining
--   the reason of the recovery point deletion failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_recoveryPointArn</a> - An Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for
--   example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionKeyArn:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_encryptionKeyArn</a> - The server-side
--   encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in
--   bytes, of a backup.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_creationDate</a> - The date and time a
--   recovery point is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal
--   Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to
--   milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday,
--   January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_completionDate</a> - The date and time a
--   job to restore a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupVaultName:RecoveryPointByBackupVault'</a>,
--   <a>recoveryPointByBackupVault_backupVaultName</a> - The name of a
--   logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are
--   identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them
--   and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They
--   consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.
newRecoveryPointByBackupVault :: RecoveryPointByBackupVault

-- | Contains information about the backup plan and rule that Backup used

--   (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example,

--   most 1,024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.

--   Audit Manager delivers your reports to Amazon S3. The prefix is this
--   part of the following path:
--   s3://your-bucket-name/<tt>prefix</tt>/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name.
--   If not specified, there is no prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:formats:ReportDeliveryChannel'</a>,
--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_formats</a> - A list of the format of your
--   reports: <tt>CSV</tt>, <tt>JSON</tt>, or both. If not specified, the
--   default format is <tt>CSV</tt>.

--   <a>reportDeliveryChannel_s3BucketName</a> - The unique name of the S3
--   bucket that receives your reports.
newReportDeliveryChannel :: Text -> ReportDeliveryChannel

-- | Contains detailed information about a report job. A report job
--   compiles a report based on a report plan and publishes it to Amazon
--   S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportJob</a> smart constructor.
data ReportJob
ReportJob' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportDestination -> Maybe Text -> ReportJob

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationTime:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_creationTime</a> -
--   The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_status</a> - The status of
--   a report job. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> means that the report is available for your review
--   at your designated destination. If the status is <tt>FAILED</tt>,
--   review the <tt>StatusMessage</tt> for the reason.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportPlanArn</a> -
--   An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The
--   format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionTime:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_completionTime</a>
--   - The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportJobId:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportJobId</a> - The
--   identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated, Unicode,
--   UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report job IDs
--   cannot be edited.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_statusMessage</a> -
--   A message explaining the status of the report job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDestination:ReportJob'</a>,
--   <a>reportJob_reportDestination</a> - The S3 bucket name and S3 keys
--   for the destination where the report job publishes the report.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportTemplate:ReportJob'</a>, <a>reportJob_reportTemplate</a>
--   - Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built
--   using a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
newReportJob :: ReportJob

--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationTime</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanName:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportPlanName</a> - The unique name of the report plan.
--   This name is between 1 and 256 characters starting with a letter, and
--   consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanArn:ReportPlan'</a>, <a>reportPlan_reportPlanArn</a>
--   - An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource.
--   The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportSetting:ReportPlan'</a>, <a>reportPlan_reportSetting</a>
--   - Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built
--   using a report template. The report templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the report template is <tt>RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt> or
--   <tt>CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT</tt>, this API resource also describes
--   the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportPlanDescription:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportPlanDescription</a> - An optional description of
--   the report plan with a maximum 1,024 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAttemptedExecutionTime:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_lastAttemptedExecutionTime</a> - The date and time that
--   a report job associated with this report plan last attempted to run,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastAttemptedExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentStatus:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_deploymentStatus</a> - The deployment status of a report
--   plan. The statuses are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSuccessfulExecutionTime:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_lastSuccessfulExecutionTime</a> - The date and time that
--   a report job associated with this report plan last successfully ran,
--   in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of
--   <tt>LastSuccessfulExecutionTime</tt> is accurate to milliseconds. For
--   example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018
--   12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportDeliveryChannel:ReportPlan'</a>,
--   <a>reportPlan_reportDeliveryChannel</a> - Contains information about
--   where and how to deliver your reports, specifically your Amazon S3
--   bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the formats of your reports.
newReportPlan :: ReportPlan

-- | Contains detailed information about a report setting.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportSetting</a> smart constructor.
data ReportSetting
ReportSetting' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ReportSetting

-- | Create a value of <a>ReportSetting</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:frameworkArns:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_frameworkArns</a> - The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs)
--   of the frameworks a report covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfFrameworks:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_numberOfFrameworks</a> - The number of frameworks a
--   report covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportTemplate:ReportSetting'</a>,
--   <a>reportSetting_reportTemplate</a> - Identifies the report template
--   for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report
--   templates are:
--   
--   <pre>
--   RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
--   </pre>
newReportSetting :: Text -> ReportSetting

-- | Contains metadata about a restore job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreJobsListMember</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreJobsListMember
RestoreJobsListMember' :: Maybe RestoreJobStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> RestoreJobsListMember

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreJobsListMember</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_status</a> - A status code specifying the
--   state of the job initiated by Backup to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_iamRoleArn</a> - Specifies the IAM role ARN
--   used to create the target recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedCompletionTimeMinutes:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_expectedCompletionTimeMinutes</a> - The
--   amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is
--   expected to take.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restoreJobId:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_restoreJobId</a> - Uniquely identifies the
--   job that restores a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_resourceType</a> - The resource type of the
--   listed restore jobs; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store
--   (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon
--   RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups,
--   the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:percentDone:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_percentDone</a> - Contains an estimated
--   percentage complete of a job at the time the job status was queried.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_accountId</a> - The account ID that owns the
--   restore job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdResourceArn:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_createdResourceArn</a> - An Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN
--   depends on the resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_statusMessage</a> - A detailed message
--   explaining the status of the job to restore a recovery point.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recoveryPointArn:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_recoveryPointArn</a> - An ARN that uniquely
--   identifies a recovery point; for example,
--   <tt>arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backupSizeInBytes:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_backupSizeInBytes</a> - The size, in bytes,
--   of the restored resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_creationDate</a> - The date and time a
--   restore job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time
--   (UTC). The value of <tt>CreationDate</tt> is accurate to milliseconds.
--   For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26,
--   2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:RestoreJobsListMember'</a>,
--   <a>restoreJobsListMember_completionDate</a> - The date and time a job
--   to restore a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and
--   Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of <tt>CompletionDate</tt>
--   is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087
--   represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.
newRestoreJobsListMember :: RestoreJobsListMember
